0.title: Pune district sees 62 new COVID cases, active cases rise to 299
0.article_body: Pune district in Maharashtra on Tuesday reported 62 new cases of COVID-19, taking the number of active cases in the district to 299. Of the new cases, 52 were reported in Pune city, seven in Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) limits and three in Pune rural. A total of 18.32 million COVID-19 vaccine doses have been administered in Pune.

1.title: It's nice to break the losing streak: Williamson on 3-run win vs MI
1.article_body: SRH captain Kane Williamson said it was nice to break their five-match losing streak after defeating MI. He added, "Had a few games where momentum wasn't on our side and we couldn't wrestle it back. All in all a very good performance." SRH now have 12 points from 13 games and will play their final league match against PBKS.

2.title: Netflix lays off 150 employees citing slowing revenue growth
2.article_body: Netflix has announced that it has laid off around 150 employees, mostly in the US, as it faces slowing revenue growth. "These changes are primarily driven by business needs rather than individual performance, which makes them especially tough," the firm said. The reductions come less than a month after Netflix reported its first subscriber loss in a decade.

3.title: 8-year-old boy dies due to intense heatwave in Punjab
3.article_body: An eight-year-old boy, Mehakpreet Singh, the resident of a village in Punjab's Sangrur district allegedly died after getting sick due to intense heatwave on Monday. "My son had got fever, loose motion and was vomiting. Doctors told us that he got dehydrated due to the heatwave," the deceased's father said. "However, no one provided proper treatment," he added.

4.title: Water-logging in many areas in B'luru amid heavy rains, IMD issues orange alert
4.article_body: Bengaluru witnessed water-logging in many areas amid heavy rains on Tuesday night. JP Nagar, Jayanagar, Lalbagh, Chickpet, Majestic, Malleswaram, and Rajajinagar, among others were the affected areas. Notably, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) on Tuesday issued an orange alert for urban and rural districts of Bengaluru, predicting heavy rainfall for the next four-five days in the city.

5.title: Punjab farmers protest at Chandigarh-Mohali border; CM says open to talks
5.article_body: After being stopped from entering Chandigarh, Punjab farmers sat on protest near Chandigarh-Mohali border on Tuesday. Farmer leader Jagjit Singh said protestors would break barricades and move towards Chandigarh if Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann fails to hold meeting with them by Wednesday. Mann said he's open for talks but hollow slogans cannot break his resolve to check depletion of groundwater.

6.title: Honeymoon pic of Depp with 2 black eyes shown to court, Amber Heard says 'It's photoshopped'
6.article_body: During actor Johnny Depp's defamation trial against his ex-wife Amber Heard, the court was shown a picture from the couple's honeymoon, wherein Depp was seen having two black eyes as he posed with Heard and three other men. "I've seen this picture before and he’s not injured in it. This one is photoshopped," Heard claimed.

7.title: Mame Khan becomes first folk artist to open red carpet for India at Cannes Film Festival
7.article_body: Rajasthani singer Mame Khan on Tuesday became the first folk artist to open red carpet for India at Cannes Film Festival. Khan was seen dressed in a traditional Rajasthani ensemble that included a vibrant pink kurta underneath an ethnic embroidered coat. Khan has sung for several Bollywood films like 'Luck By Chance' and 'No One Killed Jessica', among others.

8.title: Officials' immature response increased complexity in fighting COVID-19: Kim Jong-un
8.article_body: During a meeting amid the COVID-19 outbreak in North Korea, leader Kim Jong-un said that the "immaturity in the state capacity for coping with the crisis" increased the "complexity and hardships" in fighting the pandemic. North Korea has reported over 17 lakh patients with fever symptoms and 62 deaths as of Tuesday evening.

9.title: Chandigarh to get dedicated anti-narcotic task force, anti-dark net cell
9.article_body: A dedicated anti-narcotic task force will be set up in Chandigarh which will be headed by an Inspector General (IG)-rank officer. The decision was taken during the second state-level Narco Coordination Centre (NCORD) meeting chaired by UT Adviser Dharam Pal on Tuesday. A dedicated anti-dark net cell will also be constituted to check dark web drug trade in the city.

10.title: No compromise on security issues of Kashmiri Pandits: IGP Kashmir
10.article_body: Inspector-General of Police (IGP), Kashmir, Vijay Kumar on Tuesday said there will be no compromise on the security-related issues of Kashmiri Pandits. "The agenda of militants is to create fear among you. We will have to fight them jointly. If you get scared, then their agenda will get fulfilled," Kumar told the protesting Kashmiri Pandits at Sheikhpora transit accommodation.

11.title: 7 get life sentence for murder of former UP MLA, his aide
11.article_body: Seven people, including gangster Dhruv Singh alias Kuntu Singh, have been sentenced to life imprisonment in the murder of former MLA Sarvesh Singh 'Seepu' and his associate in UP's Azamgarh in 2013. A fine of ₹50,000 has also been imposed on each of them. The incident occurred over a fallout of a political rivalry, according to the prosecution.

12.title: Tesla to hold second artificial intelligence day on Aug 19: Musk
12.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has announced that the firm will be hosting its second artificial intelligence day on August 19. "The purpose of AI Day is to convince great AI/software/chip talent to join Tesla," he tweeted. The company held its first AI Day in August last year and a Battery Day in September 2020.

13.title: We didn't aim for 200 vs MI but went with the flow: SRH's Priyam Garg
13.article_body: SRH's Priyam Garg, who opened their innings along with Abhishek Sharma against MI, said they didn't plan to score around 200 runs but went with the flow. "It [was] 10-15 runs short given how we were going but it was a good score [that] our bowlers can defend," he added. SRH scored 193/6 and won the match by three runs.

14.title: Arrested for looting petrol pump, Punjab man kills self inside police station
14.article_body: A man, who was arrested by Punjab's Moga Police in a loot case, allegedly died by suicide inside the washroom of the lock-up of Baghapurana Police Station. The deceased was arrested for looting ₹17,000 from a petrol pump in December last year in Nathoke village. He was scheduled to be produced before the court on Tuesday.

15.title: Bombay HC rejects bail of man who induced friends to invest in crypto
15.article_body: The Bombay High Court rejected pre-arrest bail plea of a man accused of allegedly inducing two friends to invest ₹21.27 lakh in cryptocurrency TRON. According to the police, the accused told his friends that value of 1 TRON is equivalent to ₹10 and by investing in it they would earn a profit of 0.50% per TRON per day.

16.title: Apple delays plan to have US staff in office 3 days a week: Report
16.article_body: Apple is indefinitely delaying its plan to have US employees work from office three days a week due to rising COVID-19 cases, Bloomberg reported. It had planned for such a return starting May 23. It's still expecting US workers to come to the office two days per week. The staff is also required to wear masks in the common area.

17.title: Hyd growing not just in IT but in many sectors: T'gana minister
17.article_body: Hyderabad has been growing not just in the information technology sector but in many sectors like life sciences, aerospace and defence, Telangana Industry Minister KT Rama Rao said. "Seven years ago...two million square feet office space was getting leased out....has now reached 11 million square feet," he added. Our job as a government is to create more infrastructure, Rao stated.

18.title: Platform ticket price at Pune Railway Station increased to ₹30 till May 31
18.article_body: The platform ticket price at the Pune Railway Station has been increased from ₹10 to ₹30 till May 31. This has been done to control crowd at the platforms during summer vacation. "Our appeal to passengers and their relatives or friends, who come to drop or pick up, is to avoid crowding at the premises," Pune railway division spokesperson said.

19.title: Haven't done anything wrong, I was betrayed: Officer removed from Gyanvapi survey
19.article_body: Ajay Mishra, former advocate commissioner appointed for conducting the survey of Gyanvapi Mosque has said, "I've not done anything that reveals the secrecy of the matter." Mishra said he had been betrayed by advocate Vishal Singh who had "taken advantage of his trusting nature". Mishra had reportedly engaged a private person for the videography, who leaked information to the media.

20.title: We girls had male friends; they took us out, paid our bills in Delhi: Kangana
20.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut said that she and the other girls who lived with her in Delhi had made their male friends their drivers. "They used to take us out...they used to pay bills...for us," she said, adding that she experienced a "cultural shock" after coming to Mumbai. "In Mumbai...even if you are on date...you have to pay equal," she added.

21.title: Towing of vehicles must be re-introduced: Bengaluru's new police chief
21.article_body: Towing vehicles in no-parking zones must be re-introduced, Bengaluru's new Police Commissioner CH Pratap Reddy said. Towing must be brought because "handling traffic issues will be a challenge since people are returning to normal life after the COVID-19 pandemic", he added. Karnataka government suspended towing of vehicles in Bengaluru in February after allegations of corruption and harassment.

22.title: 3 more top Twitter employees leave ahead of Elon Musk's takeover
22.article_body: Twitter lost three more senior employees, including two vice presidents, ahead of Elon Musk's takeover. Ilya Brown, a VP of product management; Katrina Lane, VP of Twitter Service; and Max Schmeiser, head of data science, are all leaving the company, a Twitter spokesperson confirmed. Earlier, Twitter Chief Executive Officer Parag Agrawal fired two top executives.

23.title: 16-year-old fan's letter to MS Dhoni goes viral, CSK captain says 'Well written'
23.article_body: A 16-year-old fan's letter to CSK captain MS Dhoni went viral on social media. The official Twitter handle of CSK shared pictures of the framed letter. "If I am 7% the person you are someday, I'd consider myself blessed," a part of the letter read. Dhoni signed the letter, writing, "Well written. Best wishes."

24.title: Hanuman idol shifted to temple after clashes in MP's Neemuch
24.article_body: The Hanuman idol, which was placed near a dargah leading to communal clashes in Madhya Pradesh's Neemuch, has been shifted to a temple, said police. Five FIRs were registered and 10 people were detained by police on Tuesday. Several people were left injured in the clashes during which stones were pelted and a mosque was set on fire.

25.title: Anurag Thakur shares pics with Indian contingent at Cannes red carpet, calls it 'Historic'
25.article_body: Information & Broadcasting Minister Anurag Thakur walked the red carpet at 75th Cannes Film Festival with Indian delegation on Tuesday. Anurag shared pictures on Twitter, wherein he can be seen at the red carpet with Nawazuddin Siddiqui, R Madhavan and others. He called it a "historic moment" for India as it became the first country of honour at the festival.

26.title: Chinese plane carrying 132 people was intentionally crashed: Report
26.article_body: Flight data from one of the black boxes from the China Eastern Airlines jet indicates that someone in the cockpit intentionally crashed the plane, The Wall Street Journal reported citing people familiar with preliminary assessment by US officials. The aircraft crashed on March 21 in the mountains of Guangxi, killing all 123 passengers and nine crew members aboard.

27.title: 13-yr-old returning home on bicycle run over by car in Delhi, dies
27.article_body: A 13-year-old boy who was returning home on a bicycle was run over by a car in Delhi's Hauz Khas on Saturday and he died on Tuesday at a hospital, police said. The driver of the car has been arrested, police added. The deceased was with a friend and they were returning home after they went for a swim.

28.title: Musk's SpaceX poised to become most valuable US startup: Reuters
28.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk-owned SpaceX is poised to become the most valuable US startup as its valuation jumped to over $125 billion in an ongoing share sale in the secondary market, surpassing Stripe, Reuters reported. The shares jumped in valuation from October when SpaceX's shares were sold at $56 apiece. No new shares have been issued in the secondary offering.

29.title: Won't arrest doctors in kidney transplant case yet: Pune Police to HC
29.article_body: Pune Police on Tuesday told Bombay High Court that it'll not arrest the doctors named in an FIR in an alleged case of organ transplant malpractice yet. The court had asked the police why were they in such a hurry to arrest highly qualified doctors. Fifteen people, including some doctors of Ruby Hall Clinic, have been booked in this case.

30.title: SRH defeat MI by 3 runs, stay alive in IPL 2022 playoffs race
30.article_body: SRH defeated MI by three runs on Tuesday to stay alive in IPL 2022 playoffs race. SRH are eighth on the points table with 12 points. With the win, SRH ended their five-match losing streak in the tournament. Meanwhile, bottom-placed MI became the first team to record 10 losses in the tournament.

31.title: Bengaluru man claims family was left stranded by Ola cab, says 'drove to pick them up'
31.article_body: An Ola Cabs customer from Bengaluru has shared an experience his family underwent while using the service to Mysuru. "An hour and a half into the trip some rowdies come...and...threaten...driver to pay up his past instalments...else they'll confiscate the vehicle," he added. Stating that his family members were "abandoned on the highway", he said he drove to pick them up.

32.title: 'Haryana not releasing our share of water' says Delhi Minister; Haryana CM denies
32.article_body: Delhi Water Minister Satyendar Jain on Tuesday alleged Haryana government was depriving the national capital's residents of their rights by withholding water. Meanwhile, Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar said Delhi is being supplied its share of 1,050 cusecs of water. "On the contrary, the AAP government of Punjab is not giving Haryana's share of water," the CM further claimed.

33.title: This time we played as a team: Srikanth on India's maiden Thomas Cup win
33.article_body: Commenting on the difference between earlier Thomas Cup editions and the recent one, shuttler Kidambi Srikanth said, "This time we really played as a team [rather] than like an individual sport." He added, "We bonded really well, backed each other and really believed that we could do it." India defeated Indonesia 3-0 to win their maiden Thomas Cup on Sunday.

34.title: He's nowhere near finished article: Bishop on SRH pacer Umran Malik
34.article_body: Ex-West Indies pacer Ian Bishop praised SRH pacer Umran Mailk, saying the 22-year-old's "pace distinguishes him from every other bowler around the country and beyond now". He added, "It's been heartening watching his control improve as IPL has gone along...Malik is still a work in progress. He's nowhere near the finished article." Malik has been consistently bowling above 150 kmph.

35.title: China's 'Zero-COVID' policy is unsustainable due to Omicron: WHO
35.article_body: World Health Organization (WHO) Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus claimed that China's 'Zero-COVID' policy is unsustainable because of the highly infectious nature of the Omicron variant. "We know the virus better and we have better tools...so that's why the handling of the virus should actually be different from what we used to do at the start of the pandemic," he said.

36.title: 2 tiger cubs rescued from villagers in Madhya Pradesh's Seoni
36.article_body: Forest department officials said that two tiger cubs which were allegedly injured by angry villagers were rescued by their team in Madhya Pradesh's Seoni district. "The cubs, around 14-15 months old, might have come there to drink water. The villagers surrounded them with sticks," Chief Conservator of Forest (Seoni Circle) said. However, the official denied that the cubs were injured.

37.title: Ugandan national arrested for smuggling ₹7-crore cocaine in Mumbai
37.article_body: A Ugandan national, Brandon Sulpisious Migadde, was arrested by the Directorate of Revenue Intelligence at the Mumbai airport and cocaine worth ₹7 crore was recovered from him. Officials said that his x-ray report confirmed the presence of the foreign substances in his stomach, after which he was admitted to Sir JJ Hospital. Drugs were later recovered from him, they added.

38.title: Reliance Retail to enter beauty sector with 400 stores: Report
38.article_body: Reliance Retail is looking to enter the beauty and cosmetics segment with around 400 exclusive stores in the coming years, the Economic Times reported. The company will reportedly open two kinds of outlets, a multi-brand store modelled on Sephora and a chain of value products targeting the mass market. It'll open a high-end store, code-named Tiara, within months, ET reported.

39.title: LIC's debut 2nd-worst among 11 global companies that listed this year after raising $1bn
39.article_body: Investors of Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) lost over ₹50,000 crore on the stock's debut on May 17. Its first-day performance makes for the second-worst debut among 11 global companies that listed this year after raising at least $1 billion through first-time share sales. The shares ended 7.8% lower than the IPO price of ₹949 after losing 9.4% earlier.

40.title: Difference of opinion doesn't mean anything is wrong with MVA: Patil
40.article_body: Maharashtra Home Minister Dilip Walse Patil said, "Congress, NCP and Shiv Sena are working together. If there's a difference of opinion on a big or small issue, it doesn't mean there is something wrong with the Maha Vikas Aghadi." Three parties should work together to fight against BJP, he added. His comment came after Nana Patole called NCP a 'backstabber'.

41.title: BSE appoints ex-RBI Deputy Governor SS Mundra as Chairman
41.article_body: BSE Limited on Tuesday announced that its board has appointed Public Interest Director SS Mundra as the Chairman of the stock exchange. Mundra retired as Deputy Governor of RBI in July 2017 after a stint of three years. Prior to that, he was Bank of Baroda's Chairman and MD. He will replace Justice Vikramajit Sen.

42.title: RBI sold $20.1 billion in spot foreign exchange in March
42.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) sold a net $20.1 billion in the spot foreign exchange market in March to defend rupee against dollar, its monthly bulletin showed. RBI said its net outstanding forward dollar purchases rose to $65.79 billion in March compared to $49.11 billion in February. In March, the rupee hit its first record low for 2022.

43.title: Murder of Qandeel Baloch in Pak was heinous honour killing: Alankrita
43.article_body: Filmmaker Alankrita Shrivastava, who will be directing a film on late Pakistani social media star Qandeel Baloch, has said that she was shaken up when Qandeel was murdered in Pakistan. "It was a heinous honour killing...I started watching Qandeel's videos repeatedly, and I was fascinated," she added. Qandeel was strangled to death in 2016 by her brother Muhammad Waseem.

44.title: US Air Force claims it successfully tested a hypersonic weapon
44.article_body: The US Air Force on Monday claimed that it had successfully tested a hypersonic weapon. The test was conducted on Saturday off the coast of Southern California when a B-52 bomber released an Air-launched Rapid Response Weapon (ARRW), it added. The ARRW achieved "hypersonic speeds five times greater than the speed of sound", it further said.

45.title: G7 using Russia's reserves for Ukraine is outright theft: Kremlin
45.article_body: Kremlin said on Tuesday that G7 countries seizing frozen Russian reserves and spending them on behalf of Ukraine is "outright theft". Kremlin's reaction came as German Finance Minister Christian Lindner reportedly said that he's open to using funds from Russian reserves for reconstruction of Ukraine amid its invasion. Earlier, US also proposed transfer of Russian oligarchs' assets to help Ukraine.

46.title: Govt considers selling part of BPCL instead of full stake: Report
46.article_body: Centre is considering inviting bids for a 20%-25% stake in Bharat Petroleum Corp Ltd (BPCL), instead of selling its entire 52.98% holding, Reuters reported quoting government officials. The officials added that the discussions about the plan were in the early stages. Initially, the government had aimed to raise $8-$10 billion from selling its full stake in BPCL.

47.title: SA batter Zubayr Hamza suspended for 9 months for using banned substance
47.article_body: South Africa batter Zubayr Hamza has been suspended for nine months by ICC for a doping violation under the ICC Anti-Doping Code. The ban was backdated to March 22, 2022, the date Hamza accepted a provisional suspension. Hamza provided an out-of-competition sample on January 17, 2022, in which the prohibited substance Furosemide was found.

48.title: Terrorists attack newly opened wine shop in J&K, 1 worker killed
48.article_body: Terrorists hurled a grenade at a newly opened wine shop in Jammu and Kashmir's Baramulla district on Tuesday, killing one worker and injuring three others. All the four employees of the shop hailed from the Jammu division, a police spokesperson said. The area was cordoned off and a search was on to nab the culprits.

49.title: Not here to judge, will enjoy creative process: Deepika on being Cannes jury
49.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone, speaking about being a jury member at the 2022 Cannes Film Festival, stated, "I don't think any of us have the capacity to judge...critique...or...criticise." The actress further said that she would like to enjoy the creative process. "The idea is to remind ourselves of...audience or of that young child who's grown up watching movies," Deepika added.

50.title: Pathaan's music might be biggest one coming up: Sheykhar Ravjiani
50.article_body: Music composer Sheykhar Ravjiani, speaking about working with Shah Rukh Khan, has said, "'Om Shanti Om', 'Chennai Express', 'Happy New Year', all projects done with sir are an honour to be a part of." Speaking about composing songs for 'Pathaan', he said, "This one is a big and very special one coming up...might be...biggest one coming up so far."

51.title: Won't target any community: K'taka Minister on 'anti-conversion' law
51.article_body: Karnataka Home Minister Araga Jnanendra said that "anti-conversion" law will not target any community in the state and promised a strict implementation of the law. He said, "It is in the Constitution that there can't be forced conversions. We have just brought provision for punishment in case it happens." He added the step was taken to maintain law and order.

52.title: Indonesia to end outdoor mask mandate as COVID-19 cases decline
52.article_body: Indonesia is set to lift its outdoor mask mandate from Wednesday onwards amid a "more controlled" pandemic situation, President Joko Widodo said on Tuesday. Masks will still have to be worn indoors and on public transportation, he further said. Additionally, fully vaccinated travellers arriving in Indonesia will no longer need to undergo COVID-19 tests to enter the country.

53.title: Tom Harrison steps down as ECB CEO, to be replaced by Clare Connor on interim basis
53.article_body: Tom Harrison has announced that he is stepping down as the CEO of England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) after seven years in the role. Clare Connor, the former England Women captain, has taken over the position on an interim basis. "I believe now is the right time to bring in fresh energy to continue this work," Harrison said.

54.title: Lack of confidence: Punjab Cong as AAP asks Centre for security help
54.article_body: Punjab Congress President Amarinder Singh Raja Warring criticised the Punjab government for seeking additional security forces from the Centre, saying AAP government lacks confidence in itself. It is also an admission of failure on the security front, Warring said. "Past experience has been bitter as the state accumulated substantial debt due to security expenses," Warring added.

55.title: Britain to end its overseas aid spending in China
55.article_body: The UK on Tuesday announced that it would end all overseas aid spending in China. "We'll work with China to tackle global challenges, but we can make a bigger difference spending UK aid where it is more needed," UK's Business Secretary Kwasi Kwarteng tweeted. The UK had spent around 13 million pounds on aid to China last year.

56.title: My sister taught Depp how to snort cocaine using tampon applicator: Heard
56.article_body: Amber Heard, who was cross-examined by ex-husband Johnny Depp's legal team in the ongoing defamation trial against her, stated that her sister Whitney Henriquez taught Depp how to snort cocaine using a tampon applicator. She was shown a picture that she clicked of cocaine lines on the breakfast table. Depp is suing Heard following her claim of surviving domestic violence.

57.title: Hope SC would do complete justice: Owaisi on Gyanvapi Mosque case
57.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Tuesday hoped the Supreme Court will do "complete justice" in the Gyanvapi Mosque case. This comes after SC directed the Varanasi DM to safeguard the "Shivling" reportedly found inside the mosque complex without affecting the right of Muslims to enter and worship. Furthermore, the SC has set the next date of hearing on May 19.

58.title: Growth forecast range reasonable despite monetary tightening: CEA
58.article_body: Chief Economic Advisor Dr V Anantha Nageswaran said India's growth forecast is "reasonable" despite monetary tightening. He added that global price shocks posed "upward risks to domestic inflation", which, over time and with increase in interest rates, would dampen demand and put downward pressure on energy prices. The risk of sustained high inflation "is somewhat low" in India, he said.

59.title: Uncle-aunties of Juhu gave us chocolates 'on udhaar': Zayed Khan
59.article_body: Actor Zayed Khan has recalled his childhood days when he had no money, but the "uncles" and "aunties" in Juhu gave him chocolates or ice creams "on udhaar (on loan)". He further stated, "It was a different time where people lived on trust and [goodwill]. Those were the days." The actor further revealed that he is locally nicknamed 'Jayed'.

60.title: Was typecast after 'Banoo...', producers stopped casting me: Divyanka
60.article_body: Actress Divyanka Tripathi has revealed that she was typecast after her 2006 TV show 'Banoo Main Teri Dulhann'. "I was typecast like Tulsi (Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi)...Parvati (Kahaani Ghar Ghar Kii). So producers stopped casting me," she stated. "They were like 'You've become like Tulsi...Parvati, so we can't cast you again, no one will see you'," she added.

61.title: Mandi traders in MP go on 2-day strike against ban on wheat export
61.article_body: Mandi traders in Madhya Pradesh have gone on a two-day strike against the sudden ban on export of wheat. "The Union government should have given time of at least 15 days before taking such a decision," Mandi Traders Association president said. Traders association added that over 3,000 trucks full of wheat from Madhya Pradesh are lined up at Mumbai port.

62.title: When we won IPL in 2014: Russell on his favourite moment with KKR
62.article_body: On being asked his favourite moment with Kolkata Knight Riders, all-rounder Andre Russell said, "When we won the IPL in 2014, that was an amazing experience." Russell has, so far, scored 330 runs and taken 17 wickets in ongoing IPL. On Saturday, Russell became the fastest batter in terms of balls faced to achieve 2000-run mark in history of IPL.

63.title: Textile units in Tamil Nadu protest amid high cotton, yarn prices
63.article_body: Textile units in Tamil Nadu's Tiruppur, Karur and Erode have shut their shops in protest against the Centre amid high cotton and yarn prices. "You could buy one kg of yarn for ₹200 around 18 months ago, whereas the same amount will now fetch only 400 gm of yarn," M Raja Shanmugam, President of Tiruppur Exporters' Association (TEA) said.

64.title: Blast in Karachi market leaves 1 dead, over 10 others injured
64.article_body: A blast in a market in Pakistan's Karachi on Monday killed one person and injured over 10 others. Notably, this is the second blast in the city within the span of a week. Condemning the attack, PM Shehbaz Sharif said that enemies of people's lives and property will be dealt with iron hands.

65.title: Those guilty will be punished: Maha Minister on NCP, BJP clash
65.article_body: After NCP and BJP workers clashed at an event attended by Union Minister Smriti Irani in Pune, Maharashtra Minister Dilip Walse Patil said the guilty will be punished, irrespective of what party they belong to. NCP also alleged that a woman party member was assaulted by BJP workers. "To beat a woman office-bearer or any woman is objectionable," he added.

66.title: Declassified photos, footage of UFOs shown at US Congress hearing
66.article_body: The US' Pentagon on Tuesday showcased declassified footage of UFOs to US Congress. It included a reflective spherical object that zoomed past an aircraft, with naval intelligence deputy director Scott Bray, saying, "We don't have an explanation for this specific object." It was the first open congressional hearing on UFOs in more than 50 years.

67.title: Russia moving nuclear-capable missiles to Finland's border, say reports
67.article_body: Russia is moving nuclear-capable Iskander missiles towards its border with Finland, after the latter announced its intentions to join NATO, reports have said. A purported video clip of the Iskander missiles moving towards Vyborg, a Russian town on the Finnish border, has also surfaced online. At least seven Iskander missiles were spotted along Vyborg, reports said.

68.title: Brian Lara shares old video of his son playing with Andrew Symonds, says 'Thank you Roy!'
68.article_body: Ex-West Indies captain Brian Lara took to Instagram to share a throwback video of his son playing with late Australia all-rounder Andrew Symonds. "Thank you Roy! I will let my son know how lucky he was that day to spend some time with you," Lara wrote alongside the video. Symonds passed away aged 46 in a road accident on Saturday.

69.title: Focus must be more on Indian cinema than fashion at Cannes: Deepika
69.article_body: Deepika Padukone said people should be talking about the celebration of Indian talent and cinema at the Cannes Film Festival. The actress added fashion is fun, however, doesn't deserve "pages and pages of news". She said, "I hope...Indian media has learned from...last experience and realises...we have the power to...change that narrative...talk about what a big moment this is for India."

70.title: Amber denies defecating in Depp's bed, says his dog had 'bowel control issues'
70.article_body: Amber Heard has denied leaving faeces in Johnny Depp's bed during the defamation trial. She further alleged that one of Depp's dogs had "eaten Depp's weed as a puppy and had bowel control issues for life". When asked if she committed any sort of prank, Amber replied, "Absolutely not...I don't think that's funny. I don't know what grown woman does."

71.title: Out of all MI bowlers, I've been impressed by Sams the most: Harbhajan
71.article_body: Harbhajan Singh has said MI all-rounder Daniel Sams has impressed him the most among all the bowlers in the team in ongoing IPL. "He has a great slower delivery and that's what has allowed making such a comeback...he's a good investment for the future," he added. Sams has picked up 11 wickets in his last seven matches for MI.

72.title: No shortage of fertilisers here, India to be self-reliant soon: Mandaviya
72.article_body: Union Minister Mansukh Mandaviya said on Tuesday that there is no shortage of fertilisers in India, adding that the country will become self-reliant in the sector soon. He further said that by 2025, India will achieve self-sufficiency in urea production. The government is promoting organic farming, which would greatly reduce fertiliser consumption in the country, he added.

73.title: Bumrah becomes 1st Indian pacer to take 250 wickets in T20 cricket
73.article_body: Mumbai Indians (MI) fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah has become the first Indian pacer to take 250 wickets in T20 cricket. Overall, he is the fifth Indian to take 250 wickets in T20 cricket. Ravichandran Ashwin, Yuzvendra Chahal, Piyush Chawla and Amit Mishra are the other Indian bowlers to have taken at least 250 T20 wickets.

74.title: India appoints Naveen Srivastava as next ambassador to Nepal
74.article_body: India on Tuesday appointed Naveen Srivastava as its next ambassador to Nepal. Srivastava, who is currently serving as the additional secretary in the Ministry of External Affairs, will take up the assignment shortly. The ministry announced his appointment a day after Prime Minister Narendra Modi visited Lumbini in Nepal.

75.title: It happens only in India: Chirag Shetty on receiving call from PM after Thomas Cup win
75.article_body: Talking about receiving call from PM Narendra Modi following India's first-ever Thomas Cup win, shuttler Chirag Shetty said, "I've never seen a Prime Minister actually calling a sports team after a win." He added, "It happens only in India. It motivated us to a whole new level...We were very happy...he took out time from his busy schedule and congratulated us."

76.title: Which Indian male wrestlers have been selected for CWG 2022?
76.article_body: As many as six Indian male wrestlers have qualified for Commonwealth Games (CWG) 2022. Ravi Dahiya (57 kg), Bajrang Punia (65 kg), Naveen (74 kg), Deepak Punia (86 kg), Deepak (97 kg) and Mohit Dahiya (125 kg) were selected during the trials to represent the country at the event. The CWG 2022 will be held in Birmingham.

77.title: Asian Para Games 2022 postponed due to rising COVID-19 cases in China
77.article_body: The Asian Para Games 2022, which were scheduled to take place from October 9-15 in Hangzhou, China, have been postponed until 2023 amid a surge in COVID-19 cases in the country, the organisers announced on Tuesday. The decision comes in less than two weeks after the Hangzhou Asian Games were postponed indefinitely on May 6 due to the same reason.

78.title: CBI to probe paper leak of Himachal police constable recruitment exam
78.article_body: Himachal Pradesh government on Tuesday decided to hand over the state police constable recruitment exam's question paper leak case to CBI. It was transferred to CBI to ensure a fair and impartial probe, CM Jairam Thakur said. As many as 73 people have been arrested and over ₹8 lakh has been seized in connection to case.

79.title: Finland's Parliament approves proposal to apply for NATO membership
79.article_body: The Finnish Parliament on Tuesday approved the proposal for Finland's membership of the NATO. Of the 200 lawmakers, 188 voted in favour and eight against the application, Speaker Matti Vanhanen said. Recently, Finland and Sweden had announced their decision to join the military alliance in a historic policy shift prompted by Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

80.title: CBI probe ordered against WB minister over appointment of daughter as teacher
80.article_body: The Calcutta High Court on Tuesday directed CBI to interrogate West Bengal Minister of State for School Education PC Adhikary over alleged appointment of his daughter as a teacher in a state government-aided school. This comes after a candidate's petition claimed she was deprived of the job despite having secured higher marks than the minister's daughter in the recruitment examination.

81.title: Pune municipal commissioner acting as NCP agent, conduct early polls: BJP
81.article_body: Pune's municipal commissioner is working as an NCP agent now that the Supreme Court has allowed the Maharashtra State Election Commission to hold Pune civic polls after monsoon, said Pune BJP chief Jagdish Mulik. Maharashtra government will try to delay polls as BJP is coming back to power and thus we demand to hold elections earlier, Mulik added.

82.title: TV actress Pallavi Dey's live-in partner arrested after she was found dead at her flat
82.article_body: The Kolkata Police on Tuesday arrested late Bengali TV actress Pallavi Dey's live-in partner Sagnik Chakraborty in connection with her death. Dey was found dead at her rented flat in Kolkata's Garfa area on Sunday. This comes after the police interrogated Chakraborty for several hours on both Sunday and Monday.

83.title: Ensure zero cross-border infiltration in J&K: Amit Shah to forces
83.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday chaired a review meeting on the security situation in J&K and directed security forces and police to pro-actively conduct coordinated counter-terrorism operations in J&K. "[Shah] said to fulfill PM Narendra Modi's vision of a...peaceful J&K, security forces should ensure zero cross-border infiltration to wipe out terrorism in the Union Territory," the MHA said.

84.title: 2 pilots' licences suspended for 1 yr after flight overshot runway in MP
84.article_body: Aviation regulator DGCA has suspended the licences of two pilots of Alliance Air for one year after an aircraft with 55 passengers on board overshot the runway by 10 metres in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur in March. The plane had skidded off the runway when it suffered a tyre burst while landing. All passengers and crew members were safe.

85.title: US Prez Biden to host Sweden, Finland leaders amid NATO membership bid
85.article_body: US President Joe Biden will host his Finnish counterpart Sauli Niinistö and Sweden's PM Magdalena Andersson for a meeting at the White House on Thursday. The meeting will discuss the countries' membership bid in NATO as well as the state of European security, the White House said. Finland and Sweden will submit their respective applications to NATO on May 18.

86.title: Rare Palestinian banknote sold for ₹1.3 crore, 1,400 times its original value
86.article_body: A single rare Palestinian banknote has been sold for £140,000 (around ₹1.3 crore), which is 1,400 times its original printed value, at an online auction. The note was found in a donation box at a charity shop in UK's Essex by Oxfam volunteer Paul Wyman. It was issued to high-ranking officials during the British Mandate in Palestine in 1927.

87.title: Maha man climbing building to commit theft falls off pipe, dies
87.article_body: One person died and his associate was seriously injured after they slipped and fell from a metal pipe while trying to scale a building to allegedly commit theft in Maharashtra, police said. According to a police officer, the accused were spotted by the watchman of the building. Further investigation in the matter is underway, the officer added.

88.title: 64 police personnel now guard CM Kejriwal: Delhi Police to HC
88.article_body: Delhi Police on Tuesday told the Delhi HC that the security at Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal's residence has been increased and a proposal to curtail public entry on the road outside it is under consideration. Total strength of police personnel on CM's security now stands at 64 with 20-22 personnel at his residence round-the-clock, Senior Standing Counsel Sanjay Lao said.

89.title: US to ease restrictions on remittances and flights to Cuba
89.article_body: The US has said it'll expand flights to Cuba, take steps to ease restrictions on American travellers to the Caribbean nation and lift restrictions on remittances that immigrants can send to people on the island. Currently, the US has limited family remittances to $1,000 per quarter. "With these actions, we aim to support Cubans' aspirations...for greater economic opportunities," it added.

90.title: Rat bites female patient's eye at Rajasthan hospital's stroke unit
90.article_body: A 55-year-old female patient was allegedly bitten in her right eye by a rat at the stroke unit of the MBS hospital in Rajasthan's Kota on Monday night. The patient with Guillain-Barré syndrome has been admitted to the stroke unit for the last 45 days. The hospital's Deputy Superintendent, Samir Tondon, said the incident will be probed.

91.title: 1 hurt as fire breaks out at Delhi banquet hall, 12 tenders deployed
91.article_body: A fire broke out at the Atlantis banquet hall in Delhi's Ashok Vihar on Tuesday. Twelve fire tenders have rushed to the spot and the process of extinguishing the fire is underway, according to Delhi Fire Service. A 30-year-old man, who sustained injuries in the incident, had to be rushed to the hospital in an unconscious state.

92.title: 'Had crush on Chunky in 90s, glad nothing happened', jokes Farah Khan
92.article_body: Filmmaker Farah Khan, while speaking to Ananya Panday on 'The Khatra Khatra Show', said that she had a crush on Chunky Panday in the 90s. She added that she befriended Chunky's wife Bhavana to work with her then-boyfriend. "After working with Chunky, I'm glad...nothing happened between us. I also thanked Bhavana for getting married to him," she jokingly added.

93.title: DC have a never-say-die attitude, we're fighters: David Warner
93.article_body: After DC registered a 17-run win against PBKS in IPL 2022 and broke into top four on the points table, DC opener David Warner said the team has a "never-say-die" attitude. "We are fighters and we play to the best of our abilities..there's a hunger and desire to help each other out as we care for each other," he stated.

94.title: Education system in Himachal Pradesh is in shambles: Manish Sisodia
94.article_body: AAP's Manish Sisodia, who's on a visit to poll-bound Himachal Pradesh, said on Tuesday that education system in state is "in shambles". Sisodia stated that government schools in state lack basic infrastructure, adding that 47% of those schools also don't have a principal. "If AAP...can provide quality education in Delhi in five [years], why couldn't BJP...do so [here]," he asked.

95.title: BJP's negative thinking & hate politics must be defeated: Rahul
95.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday said the negative thinking of the BJP and its politics of hate have to be defeated if the country has to progress. Taking to Twitter, Rahul said the people's issues included "income and inflation", while the BJP's focus was on "riots and dictatorship". Earlier on Monday, Rahul had accused the BJP of "dividing" people.

96.title: Proving flights done successfully, waiting for AOC: Jet Airways
96.article_body: Jet Airways has successfully operated all proving flights and is now waiting for the grant of air operator certificate (AOC) by the Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA), owner Jalan-Kalrock Consortium said. The airline concluded its second set of proving flights with around 31 people, reportedly including DGCA officials, on Tuesday. It had conducted three proving flights on Sunday.

97.title: 26-year-old trans model-actress found dead in her house in Kerala
97.article_body: A 26-year-old trans model-actress Sherin Celin Mathew was found dead in her apartment in Kerala's Kochi on Tuesday. A police officer said that a case of unnatural death has been registered and prima facie, it appeared to be a suicide. She was reportedly suffering from depression due to some personal differences with her friends.

98.title: Russia jumps 6 positions to be India's 4th-largest oil supplier
98.article_body: Russia became the fourth-largest oil supplier to India in April, tanker tracking data showed. Russia's share in India's oil purchases rose to a record 6%, about 2,77,000 barrels per day (bpd) in April, up from about 66,000 bpd in March, when it was in 10th position. Meanwhile, the share of US oil imports almost halved to 3% in April.

99.title: Hrithik gave me his crash mat, refused to shoot until I got it: Rohit on 'Kaabil'
99.article_body: Actor Rohit Roy has said that his 'Kaabil' co-star Hrithik Roshan refused to give a shot in which they had a fight scene because the set didn't have a crash mat. "He called for his own personal crash mat and laid it down for me...A superstar like him...made sure that his co-actor was safe," Rohit said.

100.title: US FDA flags production procedure at Aurobindo Pharma's Hyd plant
100.article_body: The US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has issued six observations to Aurobindo Pharma's facility in Hyderabad's Jadcherla. As per US FDA observations, Aurobindo Pharma's Unit-VII doesn't follow written procedures for production or process controls and its batch production and control records don't include complete information. Appropriate controls aren't exercised over computers, US FDA added.

101.title: India's real fintech user base isn't more than 10-15 cr: Zerodha CEO
101.article_body: Online stockbroker Zerodha's billionaire CEO Nithin Kamath told Moneycontrol that he believes India's actual fintech user base is not more than 10-15 crore. "Eliminating merchants, there may be 20-30 crore unique UPI users...maybe 50% of those can consume fintech," Kamath said. He added, "It's going to be tough because money has been raised as if the market is 40-50 crore."

102.title: Indian Oil posts highest-ever revenue by any Indian firm in FY22
102.article_body: India's biggest oil firm Indian Oil Corporation (IOC) on Tuesday reported standalone revenue of ₹7.28 lakh crore in FY22, the highest-ever revenue reported by any Indian company, IOC Director (Finance) Sandeep Gupta said. IOC also reported its highest-ever net profit of ₹24,184.10 crore in FY22. IOC earned $18.54 on turning every barrel of crude oil into fuel in Q4 FY22.

103.title: Amit Shah holds high-level meeting on killings of Kashmiri Pandits
103.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday, in a high-level meeting, reviewed the security situation in Jammu and Kashmir following several targeted killings, including that of Kashmiri Pandits, in the Union Territory. The meeting, attended by J&K Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha and Union Home Secretary AK Bhalla, also took stock of preparedness for Amarnath Yatra, scheduled to begin on June 30.

104.title: Former CBI Director approaches Delhi HC over Twitter 'blue tick'; fined ₹10,000
104.article_body: Delhi High Court has fined former CBI Director M Nageswara Rao ₹10,000 while rejecting his plea seeking restoration of his Twitter blue verification tick. The court, in his previous appeal, had refused to intervene and asked Rao to approach Twitter. "Your client seems to have a lot of free time. Do you want a return gift from us," it stated.

105.title: Mom would've been happy to watch my 1st film: Arjun on 10yrs in B'wood
105.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor, speaking about completing 10 years of his career in Bollywood, stated that his mother would have been happy to watch his first film 'Ishaqzaade'. The actor further said that he is financially independent and stopped taking money from his father filmmaker Boney Kapoor after he became an actor. "My mother...brought us up very well," Arjun added.

106.title: Suspended CEO Ankiti Bose proposes repaying Zilingo's $40 mn-debt
106.article_body: Ankiti Bose, the suspended Indian-origin CEO of Singapore-based fashion startup Zilingo, has proposed to repay the company's entire outstanding debt worth $40 million. As per reports, this would let her gain more equity in the firm. "After Bose's suspension in April, the company missed the repayment which was due in the same month," a source told the Financial Express.

107.title: Ex-diplomat shares pic of beachside road in India, says 'Most beautiful cycling route'
107.article_body: Erik Solheim, a former Norwegian diplomat, on Tuesday tweeted an aerial shot of a beachside road in Udupi, Karnataka and wrote, "World's most beautiful cycling route?" The picture was taken by photographer Dhenesh Annamalai, who had shared it on his Instagram account. The photographer had revealed the location as Maravanthe Beach in his post.

108.title: Not the end of the road: Sachin Bansal as RBI rejects banking licence application
108.article_body: Navi Chairman Sachin Bansal said, "It is not the end of the road for us," after Navi's subsidiary Chaitanya India Fin Credit Private Limited's application for a universal banking licence was rejected by the RBI. "There are many things to explore including re-applying," said Bansal, who previously co-founded Flipkart. "We haven't received written communication from RBI yet," he added.

109.title: Delhi sees 393 new COVID cases, 2 deaths, positivity rate at 3.35%
109.article_body: Delhi has reported 393 new cases of COVID-19 and two deaths in the last 24 hours, according to data shared by the health department. The national capital witnessed a slight dip in the daily positivity rate, which stood at 3.35% on Tuesday, compared to 3.37% on Monday. There are a total of 2,910 active cases of COVID-19 in the city.

110.title: Challenge for India to sustain 8-9% growth for 30 yrs: NITI Aayog CEO
110.article_body: NITI Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant on Tuesday said the challenge for India is to "sustain high growth of 8-9% over the next three decades". Kant added that it will be difficult for India to grow at high rates without technological leapfrogging. Government's role should be in public policy and the policy should create wealth through the private sector, he added.

111.title: Abu Dhabi's IHC invests ₹15,400 crore in three Adani firms
111.article_body: Abu Dhabi-based global strategic investment company, the International Holding Company (IHC), on Tuesday announced the completion of an investment transaction worth ₹15,400 crore (around $2 billion) in three Adani portfolio companies. IHC has invested ₹3,850 crore each in Adani Green Energy and Adani Transmission, and ₹7,700 crore in Adani Enterprises, a statement from Adani said.

112.title: Asked Aamir Khan to talk about Manikarnika like I did for PK: Kangana
112.article_body: Kangana Ranaut revealed that she called Aamir Khan for her film 'Manikarnika' and asked him to come for its trial and talk about it like she did for his films like 'Dangal' and 'PK'. She further called Salman Khan a "very good friend" of hers, adding that she attended Arpita Khan and Aayush Sharma's Eid party because of Salman's invitation.

113.title: 163 BEST mini buses stay off roads due to strike in Mumbai
113.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) officials said that 163 mini buses of BEST's private contractor firm MP Group stayed off roads due to a strike over non-payment of salaries. This is the second strike by the contractor's drivers in a month. BEST spokesperson said that of the 275 mini buses of MP Group, 112 were operational.

114.title: RBI rejects six bank licence applications, including Sachin Bansal's
114.article_body: The RBI rejected six applications to set up banks under the guidelines for 'on tap' licensing of Universal Banks and Small Finance Banks. These include an application by Flipkart Co-founder Sachin Bansal's Chaitanya India Fin Credit, a microfinance entity of Navi Technologies. The RBI said the applicant was not found suitable under guidelines for 'on tap' licensing of Universal Banks.

115.title: Astronaut shares pics of rare 'Blood Moon' eclipse taken from space
115.article_body: European Space Agency astronaut Samantha Cristoforetti shared pictures of the recent total lunar eclipse from aboard the International Space Station. "A partially eclipsed Moon playing hide-and-seek with our solar panel," wrote Cristoforetti, along with the pictures. The recent eclipse had resulted in the occurrence of the rare Blood Moon that was visible from many parts of the world.

116.title: Thane man gets life term for raping, impregnating minor daughter
116.article_body: A 45-year-old man was sentenced to life imprisonment by the Thane sessions court under the POCSO Act for allegedly raping and impregnating his minor daughter. The sessions court also reportedly issued a penalty of ₹25,000 on the accused. The incident came to light in 2017 when the minor complained to her mother about abdomen pain.

117.title: Boy jumps into Thane creek, remains untraceable after 2-day search op
117.article_body: A 16-year-old boy, who jumped into a creek from Kasheli Bridge in Thane's Bhiwandi on Sunday, is still untraceable after a two-day search operation. "Due to high tide, the search operation was hampered on Sunday and had to be stopped after two hours. On Monday, we continued the operation but we were unable to find him," a civic official said.

118.title: 2 terrorist associates of Lashkar-e-Taiba arrested in J&K's Budgam
118.article_body: Two terrorists associated with the Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) have been arrested in Jammu and Kashmir's Budgam. They were arrested during a joint operation of the Jammu and Kashmir Police and security forces. Incriminating materials, explosive material and ammunition, including one hand grenade, two pistol magazines and 15 AK-47 rounds, were also recovered from their possession, the police said.

119.title: 96 dengue cases reported in Delhi from January to mid-May: Report
119.article_body: At least 96 dengue cases have been reported in Delhi between January and mid-May, a report citing the South Delhi Municipal Corporation (SDMC) stated. No deaths were reported due to the vector-borne disease so far, the report added. Civic body officials said that this year, dengue cases are being recorded early due to the congenial weather for mosquito-breeding.

120.title: TMC will be in position to form govt in Goa by next polls: Kirti Azad
120.article_body: Trinamool Congress' (TMC) Kirti Azad said on Tuesday that party will be better positioned to form government in Goa by next Assembly polls. He added that TMC's performance was better than BJP and Congress' initial electoral stints in state. Azad took over as Goa unit incharge after ex-party state president Kiran Kandolkar resigned citing bleak prospects for TMC in Goa.

121.title: MI to bowl first against SRH, both teams make 2 changes each
121.article_body: MI captain Rohit Sharma won the toss and elected to bowl first against SRH in their IPL 2022 clash on Tuesday. MI have included Mayank Markande and Sanjay Yadav in place of Hrithik Shokeen and Kumar Kartikeya. Meanwhile, Priyam Garg and Fazal Farooqi have replaced Shashank Singh and Marco Jansen in SRH's playing XI.

122.title: Gyanvapi-like incidents deliberately stirred up by BJP: Akhilesh
122.article_body: Amid the ongoing controversy over the Gyanvapi Mosque in Varanasi, Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav on Tuesday said, "Gyanvapi-like incidents being deliberately stirred up by BJP itself or by their aides behind...veil." "BJP has [a] hate calendar to bring up such issues until elections," the SP chief said. "They [BJP] don't have answers on inflation and unemployment," Akhilesh added.

123.title: US better positioned to lead the world in 21st century: Biden
123.article_body: US President Joe Biden, in a letter, has said that America is better positioned than any other country to lead the world in the 21st century. "I'm confident that we can work together to find common ground to make America a more just, prosperous, and secure nation," he added. The letter was addressed to Boston-based Indian-American social worker Abhishek Singh.

124.title: Don't think SRH will qualify for playoffs: Harbhajan ahead of SRH-MI
124.article_body: Speaking about eighth-placed SRH's chances of qualifying for IPL 2022 playoffs ahead of their match against MI, Harbhajan Singh stated, "As bitter as it may seem, I don't think Hyderabad will qualify." He added that SRH, who have lost five matches in a row, will have to play far better cricket now. SRH have won five matches so far.

125.title: SC notice to Hindu petitioners in Gyanvapi case; hearing on May 19
125.article_body: The Supreme Court (SC) on Tuesday issued a notice to Hindu petitioners and the Uttar Pradesh government on pleas challenging the orders of a district court in Varanasi, which directed the video survey of the Gyanvapi Mosque complex. The court will next hear the matter on May 19. The SC didn't pronounce a stay on proceedings before the Varanasi court.

126.title: Farmers protest against Indonesia's ban on palm oil export
126.article_body: Hundreds of farmers in Indonesia on Tuesday staged a protest against the country's decision to ban the export of palm oil last month. The export of crude palm oil and some of its derivative products was banned to control soaring prices of domestic cooking oil. A sign at the protest read, "Malaysian farmers are wearing full smiles, Indonesian farmers suffer."

127.title: Major fire breaks out at Bharat chemical factory in Gujarat's Dahej, 6 injured
127.article_body: At least six workers were injured after a massive fire broke out at Bharat Rasayan company at Dahej GIDC industrial estate in Gujarat's Bharuch district on Tuesday. The rescue operation was underway, Superintendent of Police Leena Patil said. "The picture will become clear once the fire is doused and rescue teams enter the premises," the District Collector Tushar Sumera said.

128.title: SRK told me on 'Baazigar' set, 'Look at the camera': Shilpa Shetty
128.article_body: Actress Shilpa Shetty has revealed her 'Baazigar' co-star Shah Rukh Khan gave her advice on her first day of shoot 30 years ago. "At that time, I'd quickly say my lines and finish it off and not face the camera. So Shah Rukh would say 'Look at the camera, the camera is your audience and say the lines'," Shilpa recalled.

129.title: Wrestler Satender assaults referee after losing final at CWG trials, gets life ban
129.article_body: Services' wrestler Satender Malik assaulted senior referee Jagbir Singh after losing the 125kg final during the Commonwealth Games (CWG) 2022 trials. Jagbir had ruled in favour of Satender's opponent Mohit after being asked to look into a challenge, following which Satender lost the bout. The Wrestling Federation of India (WFI) has imposed a life ban on Satender.

130.title: Don't feel need to shout about my work from rooftops: Nargis
130.article_body: Actress Nargis Fakhri stated she is "pretty humble and shy" and doesn't feel the need to shout about her work from rooftops. She added she was nominated for the MTV Movie Awards for her role in Melissa McCarthy and Jude Law-starrer 'Spy'. "I probably should've been more proactive to talk about it. Maybe I just didn't realise that," Nargis said.

131.title: I've had a great stint as B'luru Police Commissioner: Kamal Pant
131.article_body: Former Bengaluru Police Commissioner Kamal Pant on Tuesday thanked the citizens of the city for their support. "I've had a great stint as the Commissioner of Police," Pant tweeted. Notably, Pant has been transferred to the post of DGP, Recruitment, while CH Pratap Reddy, the ADGP of the Law and Order Department, has been appointed the new Bengaluru Police Commissioner.

132.title: Should've chased 160 with our present batting lineup: Jitesh on PBKS' loss
132.article_body: After PBKS' 17-run defeat against DC in IPL 2022, PBKS wicketkeeper-batter Jitesh Sharma said with the team's current batting line-up they should have chased the 160-run target at DY Patil Stadium. "Had one or two batters from the top order settled for long, we could've won the match," he added. With a 34-ball 44, Jitesh was the top-scorer for PBKS.

133.title: BJP-ruled MCD illegally gave licence to Mundka building owner: AAP
133.article_body: AAP on Tuesday said BJP-ruled MCD "illegally" gave licence to Mundka building owner Manish Lakra. "When the law states that commercial activity cannot be carried out in Lal Dora extension, how did Manish Lakra get this licence?" AAP MLA Atishi said. This comes after the building in Mundka caught fire on Friday and led to the death of 27 people.

134.title: Depp won't look at Heard, promised she won't see his eyes: Depp's lawyer
134.article_body: Johnny Depp's lawyer cross-examined Amber Heard amid the ongoing defamation trial against her, explaining why Depp hasn't looked at her. He said, "[Depp] promised you you'd never see his eyes again, is that true?" to which Heard responded, "I don't recall if he said that." Heard's spokesperson earlier said they wonder why Depp "won't even look" at Heard throughout proceedings.

135.title: Prabhas looks very cool in introduction bit in 'Project K': Director
135.article_body: Filmmaker Nag Ashwin, while replying to a fan on Twitter, has revealed that one schedule of Prabhas-starrer 'Project K' has been shot. Ashwin tweeted, "We've just completed one schedule including Prabhas' intro bit...he looks very cool." He further added that the next schedule will begin in June. The film also marks actress Deepika Padukone's Telugu debut.

136.title: Karnataka Governor gives his consent to ordinance on anti-conversion bill
136.article_body: Karnataka Governor Thaawarchand Gehlot on Tuesday gave his consent to the ordinance on an anti-conversion bill passed in state Assembly. The Karnataka Protection of Right to Freedom of Religion Bill aims to stop forced religious conversions and unauthorised inter-religious marriages. Earlier today, state Home Minister Araga Jnanendra said the step was taken to maintain peace and order in society.

137.title: Riders get stuck at 235 feet after rollercoaster malfunction in UK, video surfaces
137.article_body: A group of rollercoaster riders were left stranded at a height of 235 feet because of a glitch at an amusement park in the UK recently. The incident took place at the Blackpool Pleasure Beach. It was recorded by a rider who got off the rollercoaster before it stopped. No one was injured during the incident.

138.title: Don't spread rumours: 'Taarak Mehta...' actor Mandar on death rumours
138.article_body: Actor Mandar Chandwadkar, who plays the role of Bhide in 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah', has refuted the rumours about his death. Taking to Instagram Live, Mandar said, "I am well and shooting for the show. Kindly don't spread such rumours." "God grant such people common sense," actor Dilip Joshi, who plays Jethalal in the show, said off-camera.

139.title: 60-yr-old lawyer killed, body thrown in Lonavala over a land deal
139.article_body: A 60-year-old lawyer from Pune was killed and his body was thrown near Tiger Point in Lonavala after a dispute over a land deal. He was missing from the Mulshi area since May 11. Four people, including a 22-year-old prime suspect, have been arrested by the Pune Rural Police in this case.

140.title: NCPCR summons Twitter for not filing report against Kamra over edited video
140.article_body: The National Commission for Protection of Child Rights has summoned Twitter India's communications director on Wednesday for not submitting an action taken report against stand-up comedian Kunal Kamra. He had posted an edited video of a boy who sang for PM Narendra Modi in Germany. The child rights body had sought action against Kamra on May 5.

141.title: SC judges hearing Gyanvapi Mosque case were also involved in 2019 Babri verdict
141.article_body: Supreme Court Justices DY Chandrachud and PS Narasimha, who are hearing the Gyanvapi Mosque case, were also involved in the 2019 Babri Masjid verdict. While Justice Chandrachud was part of the five-judge bench that passed the historic verdict, Justice Narasimha appeared for the Hindu petitioners in the case. The Babri site in Ayodhya was handed over for Ram Temple construction.

142.title: N Korea sends planes to China to pick up medical supplies: Report
142.article_body: North Korea sent three planes to China to bring back medical supplies days after it confirmed its first COVID-19 outbreak, a South Korean news report said on Tuesday. Earlier, China had said that it would help North Korea fight the pandemic if it asked for it. Notably, North Korea has reported that 14.8 lakh people have fever symptoms.

143.title: Rohit rightly mentioned Tilak could be all-format player for India: Gavaskar
143.article_body: Praising 19-year-old Tilak Varma, ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said the MI batter's temperament has been fantastic in ongoing IPL. Gavaskar also backed Rohit Sharma's claim that Tilak can become an "all-format player" for Team India. "He's got the basics right. Technically he's right," he added. Tilak is the leading-scorer for MI, with 368 runs from 12 matches so far.

144.title: India will now be considered a badminton superpower: Prakash Padukone
144.article_body: Following India's first-ever Thomas Cup title win in Bangkok recently, ex-Indian badminton player Prakash Padukone said, "India will be considered a superpower and a threat from now on." He added, "It was a complete team effort..and a momentous occasion. I think it is equally great or perhaps greater than individual success." India beat defending champions and 14-time winners Indonesia 3-0.

145.title: Rajnath launches 2 frontline warships, praises Navy's 'aatmanirbharta'
145.article_body: Union Defence Minister Rajnath Singh launched two frontline warships, INS Udaygiri and INS Surat, in Mumbai on Tuesday. Singh also praised Navy for ensuring 'aatmanirbharta' through manufacturing indigenous equipment. "INS Udaygiri and INS Surat are...examples of India’s growing indigenous capability. [They] will be among the most...advanced missile carriers in the world," he said at the launch.

146.title: Rachakonda Police urge people to give info on drugs, share number
146.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police on Tuesday took to Twitter to share a post about drug awareness. "Addiction not only kills the addict but also kills the family!!" Rachakonda Police tweeted. "We urge the citizens to share any type of information of marijuana, ganja and other narcotics through WhatsApp or SMS to 9490617111. Your identity will be kept confidential," police wrote.

147.title: Delhi govt starts identifying land for setting up food truck hubs
147.article_body: Delhi government has started identifying land for setting up food truck hubs, as announced in Rozgar Budget 2022-23, officials said. Teams of Delhi Tourism and Transport Development Corporation and land owning agencies are conducting surveys. The hubs would create a "vibrant nightlife experience" besides serving as a catalyst to Delhi's night-time economy, Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said earlier.

148.title: Secure Shivling without affecting Muslims' right to worship: SC on Gyanvapi mosque
148.article_body: While hearing a plea challenging the survey of Gyanvapi mosque, the Supreme Court asked Varanasi DM to protect the area where the Shivling was found without affecting the right of Muslims to enter and worship. The Supreme Court also told Solicitor General Tushar Mehta, appearing for Uttar Pradesh government, that it needed assistance from him in certain issues.

149.title: India truly has potential to become content hub of world: PM Modi
149.article_body: Ahead of the presence of Union Minister Anurag Thakur-led Indian delegation at Cannes 2022 red carpet, PM Narendra Modi said he is delighted to learn about India's participation as a 'Country of Honour' at the festival. "India is the largest film producing country in the world...India truly possesses immense potential to become the content hub of the world," he added.

150.title: US inflation caused by govt printing more money than it had: Elon Musk
150.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk, when asked about the US inflation at a recent event, said, "The honest reason for inflation is that the government printed a zillion amount of more money than it had." According to a live-streamed video of his remarks posted by a Twitter user, Musk said that the US economy was "probably" in a recession.

151.title: Woman selling 118 litres of her own breast milk amid baby formula shortage in US
151.article_body: A mother from Utah, named Alyssa Chitti, is offering help to families by selling 4,000 ounces (118 litres) of her own breast milk amid the baby formula shortage in US. Due to her oversupply, she has more than three freezers of breast milk. Alyssa said she plans to sell it at $1 per ounce but is open to negotiations.

152.title: 3 accused in Delhi's Mundka building fire case sent to police custody
152.article_body: A Delhi court on Tuesday granted one-day police custody of Mundka building fire case's accused Manish Lakra, Harish Goyal and Varun Goyal. The Goyal brothers ran an industrial unit in the building owned by Manish which caught fire and led to the death of 27 people. This comes after National Human Rights Commission took suo moto cognisance of the incident.

153.title: Mathura court to hear plea seeking to seal Shahi Idgah near Krishna Janmabhoomi
153.article_body: A Mathura court has agreed to hear a plea, seeking to seal the Shahi Idgah Masjid near Krishna Janmabhoomi in the Uttar Pradesh district on July 1. The petitioner in his plea sought deployment of security there "to ensure that ancient Hindu religious symbols aren't damaged". The petitioner reportedly cited Gyanvapi mosque video survey in the plea.

154.title: SC fines 2 advocates ₹8 lakh, calls their plea on pollution norms a 'misadventure'
154.article_body: The Supreme Court on Tuesday imposed an "exemplary" ₹8 lakh fine on two advocates for their plea challenging the ban in Delhi on diesel vehicles older than 10 years and petrol vehicles older than 15 years. "Two advocates who are practising in the SC have entered into this misadventure. We warned them about this," it added. The plea was dismissed.

155.title: Won't pick glass in front of Ronit unless he asks me to drink with him: Rohit
155.article_body: Actor Rohit Bose Roy said that his brother and actor Ronit Roy is like a father to him. "Even today, I wouldn't pick up a glass in front of him unless...he asks me to have a drink with him. Jealousy is a word that doesn't exist...in either of our dictionaries...Our bringing up has been very solid that way," he added.

156.title: Plea to restore 27 temples in Qutub Minar complex adjourned to May 24
156.article_body: The Saket court in Delhi on Tuesday adjourned hearing on a plea seeking the restoration of an alleged temple complex on the Qutub Minar premises to May 24. The plea states that the Quwwat-Ul-Islam Masjid was built in place of a temple complex comprising 27 Hindu and Jain temples. The temples were "dismantled, desecrated and damaged", the plea stated.

157.title: Canada to quickly ratify Finland, Sweden's membership in NATO: Minister
157.article_body: Canada will quickly ratify Finland and Sweden's membership in NATO as and when it's approved, Foreign Minister Melanie Joly has said. Joly's comment comes as Finland and Sweden have announced their intent to join the alliance, while the latter has also formally applied for the same. Finland and Sweden will require approval of all 30 member countries to join NATO.

158.title: Didn't donate $7mn divorce settlement to charity due to Depp's lawsuit: Heard
158.article_body: Amber Heard, during Johnny Depp's defamation trial, said she didn't donate the $7 million divorce settlement she received to charity as she promised. "I...intend on honouring...my pledges...would love Depp to stop suing me so I can," she said. Amber had pledged to split her entire settlement and donate it to American Civil Liberties Union (ACLU) and Children's Hospital Los Angeles.

159.title: Neil Patrick Harris apologises for old Amy Winehouse joke
159.article_body: Actor Neil Patrick Harris has apologised for his old joke about late singer Amy Winehouse which he made shortly after her death. A Halloween dinner hosted by Neil and his husband 11 years ago featured a buffet platter made to look like the corpse of Amy. "It was regrettable then...it remains regrettable now...I'm sorry for...hurt this image caused," Neil stated.

160.title: Noida Authority to spend ₹24 crore to develop urban villages
160.article_body: The Noida Authority sanctioned ₹24 crore to develop villages by repairing and constructing roads, drains, footpaths and green spaces. The amount will be spent on 33 different projects to be completed by November 2022. "We decided to start work on these projects without any delay after the villagers made their demands on urgent basis," a senior Noida Authority official said.

161.title: US Special Coordinator for Tibet arrives on India and Nepal visit
161.article_body: US Special Coordinator for Tibetan Issues Uzra Zeya arrived in India on Tuesday to "deepen cooperation on human rights and democratic governance goals, and to advance humanitarian priorities". "Namaste! Great to be back in New Delhi," Zeya tweeted. She will also visit Nepal during the trip to hold discussions on the same areas with the country's government.

162.title: Discussions with Turkey can solve NATO objection issue: Finland Prez
162.article_body: Finnish President Sauli Niinisto said Finland and Sweden will be able to reach an agreement with Turkey over its objections to the two Nordic countries' plans to join NATO. "Statements from Turkey have very quickly changed and become harder during the last few days...But I am sure that, with the help of constructive discussions, we'll solve the situation," he added.

163.title: Kartik, Kiara visit Gurdwara Bangla Sahib ahead of Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2 release
163.article_body: Kartik Aaryan and Kiara Advani jetted off to New Delhi where they visited Gurdwara Bangla Sahib to seek blessings ahead of the release of their upcoming film 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'. Photos and videos of the two visiting the Gurdwara have surfaced online. In the photos, Kiara has donned a neutral-toned salwar suit, while Kartik wore a white kurta and jeans.

164.title: Hard to see how SRH could possibly win their last 2 games: Lisa Sthalekar
164.article_body: Ex-Australia cricketer Lisa Sthalekar has said it's hard to see how SRH, who have lost their last five games in a row, could possibly win their remaining games in IPL 2022. "[In] last two games, they scored 120-odd runs. You aren't gonna win many games...like that," she added. SRH will face MI and PBKS in their last two league matches.

165.title: Motorists to get traffic e-challans on WhatsApp: Cyberabad Police
165.article_body: Cyberabad Police have informed that motorists who have violated traffic rules will soon be getting traffic e-challans on their WhatsApp numbers. Taking to Twitter, Cyberabad Police said, "Motorists violating traffic rules will soon be sent an e-challan with a photo of the violation to their WhatsApp [numbers]." "Preparations are underway to bring this policy within a week," Cyberabad Police added.

166.title: Char Dham yatra on Badrinath route stops as boulders fall from hill
166.article_body: Traffic movement on the Badrinath route near Panchpulia in Uttarakhand's Karnaprayag was disrupted after boulders fell from a hill on Tuesday. The Char Dham yatra through this route was stopped due to the closure of the highway. Efforts are underway to open the route for traffic. The yatra was earlier suspended on Monday due to heavy rainfall in the state.

167.title: 24-yr-old man dies in Moga due to 'shock' after injecting drugs, 2 held
167.article_body: A 24-year-old man died from purported "shock" after injecting narcotics into his body in Moga district on Monday. Ludhiana Police booked four persons and arrested two of them for allegedly supplying drugs to him. As per the deceased's family, he used to take drugs and on Sunday he had taken an injection, a police official said.

168.title: Olivia Colman, Jessie Buckley to reunite for 'Wicked Little Letters'
168.article_body: Oscar-winning actress Olivia Colman and 'Chernobyl' star Jessie Buckley are teaming up again, after 'The Lost Daughter', for a comedy film, 'Wicked Little Letters'. Thea Sharrock, known for directing 'Me Before You', has been roped in to helm the upcoming project. Thea said that 'Wicked Little Letters' is a divine comedy which is based on a true story.

169.title: Kareena, Jaideep & I are having a blast: Vijay Varma on shooting in Darjeeling
169.article_body: Speaking about shooting in Darjeeling for his upcoming project with Sujoy Ghosh, actor Vijay Varma said, "Darjeeling is...a beautiful...place with an old-world charm, it's a peaceful getaway." "Kareena, Jaideep and I are having a blast shooting...and...we're just lucky to be escaping the heatwave and enjoying the pleasant weather of this city and of course, their momos," he added.

170.title: Bulldozers will be used against innocent Muslims: Owaisi on Neemuch incident
170.article_body: Reacting to incidents of communal clashes in MP's Neemuch, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi criticised CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan and said, "We know Bulldozers will be used against innocent Muslims only." "Sir @CMMadhyaPradesh will your government arrest the accused for desecrating masjid and dargah," Owaisi said. Clashes broke out after some people placed Lord Hanuman's idol near a dargah in Neemuch.

171.title: Attendance through app made mandatory for MGNREGS workers: Report
171.article_body: The Centre has reportedly made it mandatory for workers under MGNREGS to time-stamp attendance through a mobile application and geo-tag photographs, rather than recording manual attendance. The decision related to time-stamp attendance is taken to find out loopholes in the programme and bring more transparency, the report said. Currently, there are 15 crore active workers registered under MGNREGS.

172.title: Wanted his autograph, but realised it wouldn't look good for 1st impression: Lee on Sachin
172.article_body: Brett Lee revealed that he met Sachin Tendulkar for the first time in 1999 when he was playing for Prime Minister's XI against touring Indian team. "I actually wanted to get his autograph...I thought I'll give him the ball and say...'Hey mate, could you please sign this?' but then realised it wouldn't look good for my first impression," he added.

173.title: SC Collegium recommends Satish Chandra as new Delhi HC chief justice
173.article_body: Supreme Court Collegium has recommended the transfer of Telangana High Court Chief Justice Satish Chandra Sharma as the new chief justice of the Delhi High Court. After the retirement of Justice DN Patel as the Delhi High Court Chief Justice, Justice Vipin Sanghi was appointed as the Acting Chief Justice. Now, Justice Sanghi has been transferred to Uttarakhand High Court.

174.title: We share deep love for each other: Harry Styles on One Direction bandmates
174.article_body: Harry Styles opened up on his One Direction days and his bond with his bandmates. He revealed how the band members always looked out for each other. "I feel really lucky that we always had each other," he said. "There is [so] much...respect between all of us...it's like a very deep love for each other, I think," he added.

175.title: Liam Livingstone is just the perfect modern T20 cricketer: Bhogle
175.article_body: Commentator Harsha Bhogle has termed PBKS all-rounder Liam Livingstone "the perfect modern T20 cricketer".
