Bhogle added, "He bats anywhere, hits long...can give you four overs turning the ball away from right and left handers, fields well in the deep." Livingstone, who has 388 runs in 13 matches this IPL season, bowled off-spin and leg-spin to pick three wickets against DC.

176.title: 2 friends drown in Narmada backwaters in MP while swimming
176.article_body: Two friends, who went swimming in the backwaters of the Narmada river in Madhya Pradesh's Khandwa district, reportedly died after drowning on Sunday. Abhishek Kushwaha (23) and his friend Vikas Phoolmali (25) went to Sant Singaji Samadhi Sthal with their families and decided to go swimming. They reportedly ventured into deep waters, where they got trapped and drowned, police said.

177.title: 5 of family killed, 12 injured in road accident on Delhi-Jaipur highway
177.article_body: Five family members died while 12 persons were injured, when the multi-utility vehicle (MUV) they were travelling in, rammed into a stationary truck on the Delhi-Jaipur highway near Audhi village in Haryana on Tuesday. The deceased were residents of Jaipur in Rajasthan. They were returning from Haridwar after immersing the ashes of a relative.

178.title: Why does BJP hate Bhagat Singh: Kejriwal on K'taka's textbook decision
178.article_body: After reports of chapter on Bhagat Singh being removed from class 10 textbooks in Karnataka, Aam Aadmi Party chief Arvind Kejriwal took to Twitter to ask, "Why do BJP people hate amar shaheed Sardar Bhagat Singh ji so much?" "Removal of Sardar Bhagat Singh ji's name...from school books is an...insult to the sacrifice of amar shaheed," his tweet further read.

179.title: Hyundai Santro discontinued in India again: Report
179.article_body: Hyundai Motor India has discontinued its hatchback Santro in India again due to an increase in vehicle prices resulting in falling demand for cars from the entry car buyers, The Economic Times reported. The last unit of the latest generation Santro was reportedly produced last week. Santro was relaunched in 2018 at a price of ₹3.9 lakh to ₹5.5 lakh.

180.title: Byju's in talks to acquire US-based edtech firm Chegg Inc or 2U Inc: Reports
180.article_body: Byju’s is in discussion to acquire a US-based online tutoring company and is likely to bid for either Chegg Inc or 2U Inc, as per reports. While Chegg’s market value was $2.3 billion as of Friday’s close, 2U had a market value of $756 million and more than $1 billion in debt and other liabilities.

181.title: N Korea COVID outbreak could've devastating impact on human rights: UN
181.article_body: The UN said that the measures taken by North Korea's government to fight the first reported COVID-19 outbreak could have "devastating" consequences for human rights in the country. The new restrictions may make it difficult for people to meet their basic needs, including getting enough food, UN Human Rights Office spokesperson Liz Throssell said. The country is under strict lockdown.

182.title: NCP MLA Jagtap narrowly escapes after bus, his car collide in Maha
182.article_body: NCP MLA Sangram Jagtap and three others had a narrow escape on Tuesday after a bus and the car they were travelling in collided in Maharashtra's Raigad, police said. The accident occurred after the bus driver suddenly changed lanes, a police official said. "While...car was badly damaged, none of us were hurt because of seat belts and airbags," Jagtap added.

183.title: Tribal man arrested for raping physically disabled woman in Jharkhand
183.article_body: A tribal man was arrested on Tuesday for allegedly raping a physically disabled woman in Jharkhand's East Singhbhum district. The incident occurred on May 13 when the woman had gone to Kandidumri jungle to collect firewood, where the accused gagged her mouth and raped her, a police officer said. He also threatened the victim against informing anyone, the officer added.

184.title: Mali junta says soldiers backed by a Western state attempted coup
184.article_body: Mali's junta has claimed that it thwarted a coup attempt by soldiers who were supported by a "Western state", the name of which it did not reveal. A junta spokesperson said that the government condemned the "outrageous attack on state security, the purpose of which is to hinder - or even annihilate - the substantial efforts to secure our country".

185.title: Metal balls that fell from space in Gujarat might be from Chinese rocket: Experts
185.article_body: After pictures showed mysterious metal balls that fell from space at different locations in Gujarat's Anand district, some experts stated they may be debris of a Chinese rocket or fuel storage tanks of space launch vehicles. US-based astronomer Jonathan McDowell said the metal spheres are likely to be debris of Chinese rocket Chang Zheng 3B (CZ 3B).

186.title: Lawyer leading Gyanvapi Mosque video survey removed by Varanasi court
186.article_body: Advocate-Commissioner Ajay Kumar Mishra, who was leading the video survey team of the Gyanvapi Mosque complex in UP, was removed by a Varanasi court on Tuesday. The court-appointed commission that carried out the survey was given two additional days to submit the survey report. A hearing challenging the survey is currently underway in the Supreme Court.

187.title: Video shows Indian American student being bullied; school suspends him for 3 days
187.article_body: A video showing an Indian American student being bullied at a Texas school has been widely shared on social media. The video shows a student choking the Indian American boy after he refused to give up his seat. The parents of the bullied student said their son received a three-day suspension while the other student was handed a single-day suspension.

188.title: We worked in isolation; there was Hindi industry & Telugu industry: Deepika
188.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone, who's a member of the Cannes jury this year, said it's "only a matter of time" until Indian cinema witnesses global breakthrough. "Globally, Indian...movies are...recognised but within India also we're seeing a shift," she added. "Earlier, we worked in isolation, there was...Hindi film industry...Telugu film industry...and now those guardrails are coming down," she said.

189.title: Going to Cannes is something I never imagined, can't wait to be there: Helly
189.article_body: Actress Helly Shah will be making her debut at the Cannes Film Festival this year. While speaking about her Cannes debut, the actress said, "Going to Cannes is something I never imagined. I can't wait to be there." Helly, who'll be launching the poster of her debut film 'Kaya Palat' at the event, added that she's nervous and "super excited".

190.title: We just don't know: Andrew Symonds' sister on what he was doing on a lonely road at night
190.article_body: On being asked what Andrew Symonds was doing on the lonely road late at night when he met with an accident, the late Australian cricketer's sister Louise Symonds said, "We just don't know." "It's just awful," she added. Queensland Police are investigating the crash and will prepare a report for the coroner.

191.title: How long are you going to carry him: RP Singh on SRH skipper Williamson
191.article_body: Talking about Kane Williamson, who has scored 208 runs from 12 matches so far in IPL 2022, RP Singh said that the SRH skipper can be dropped from playing XI as the results aren't coming through. "How long are you going to carry him? He is a professional cricketer as well," he added. Eighth-placed SRH will face MI today.

192.title: SC grants 3 months interim bail to Haridwar Dharam Sansad case accused
192.article_body: Supreme Court on Tuesday granted interim bail for three months to Jitendra Narayan Tyagi on medical grounds in connection with the Haridwar Dharam Sansad case involving alleged inflammatory speeches. Uttarakhand High Court had dismissed Tyagi's bail plea in March. The participants in the Sansad, organised from December 17-19 in 2021, were allegedly instigated to wage a war against Muslims.

193.title: At least 7 killed due to flood in Assam, rescue operation underway
193.article_body: At least seven people died and over two lakh people have been affected due to floods across Assam's 24 districts, the Assam State Disaster Management Authority said. The government has opened 55 relief camps, which are currently sheltering 32,959 people. Rescue operation in the flood-hit areas is being carried out by NDRF, SDRF, Fire and Emergency Services and local residents.

194.title: Ramp up COVID vaccination drive for kids aged 12-14: UP CM to officials
194.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Tuesday instructed officials to ramp up the ongoing COVID-19 vaccination drive for children aged 12-14 years. At present, over 77 lakh children in the 12-14 age group have been administered vaccine doses in state. The CM also directed authorities to undertake awareness campaigns and encourage those above 18 years to take the precaution dose.

195.title: 4 accused in 1993 Bombay serial bomb blast case arrested in Gujarat
195.article_body: Four people allegedly involved in the 1993 Bombay serial bomb blast case have been arrested by the Anti-Terrorists Squad in Gujarat's Ahmedabad. "We are investigating the exact role of the four accused in the bomb blasts and their purpose of coming to Ahmedabad," the ATS Additional Director General said. The blasts killed 257 persons and injured over 709.

196.title: Tomato prices rise up to ₹100 per kg in Bengaluru: Report
196.article_body: The retail price of tomatoes has risen to between ₹80 and ₹100 per kilogram in Bengaluru and adjoining areas, according to a report. This comes as the heavy rainfall and Cyclone Asani in Karnataka have greatly affected the tomato crop, resulting in skyrocketing prices, the report added. The prices of several other green vegetables have also reportedly witnessed a rise.

197.title: 2 arrested for stealing ₹7,900 & phone from man in Gurugram: Police
197.article_body: Two men were arrested by Gurugram Police on Monday for stealing cash worth ₹7,900 and a phone from a man in Shivaji Nagar on May 10. The police said that the victim had suffered minor injuries in the incident. Notably, a video of the incident, recorded on a CCTV camera of a hardware shop, was widely shared on social media.

198.title: Bharti Airtel's net profit rises over 2 fold YoY to ₹2,008 cr in Q4
198.article_body: Bharti Airtel on Tuesday reported a 165% YoY rise in its net profit in Q4 FY22 to ₹2,008 crore, against ₹759 crore in Q4 FY21. Its consolidated revenues in Q4 rose 22% YoY to ₹31,500 crore, up from ₹25,747 crore. Bharti Airtel's consolidated profit after tax for FY22 jumped to ₹4,255 crore from the loss of ₹15,083 crore in FY21.

199.title: Microsoft to 'nearly double' salaries to retain employees, raises stock option
199.article_body: Microsoft announced that it will "nearly double" its budget for merit-based employee pay increases in order to retain its employees. The company said it will also increase its annual stock options by 25%. In an email to Microsoft employees, CEO Satya Nadella wrote, "Because of the amazing work you do...we're making long-term investments in each of you."

200.title: My daughter appreciated me: Mahesh Babu on Sarkaru Vaari Paata's success
200.article_body: Speaking about his family's reaction to the success of his film 'Sarkaru Vaari Paata', Mahesh Babu said, "When I first saw 'Sarkaru Vaari Paata' with my family, Gautham (son) shook my hand and hugged me. My daughter appreciated me for my acting in the movie." "My sincere thanks to...the cast, technicians and producers for giving me this blockbuster," he added.

201.title: Status of religious places should be as per Act: Kharge on Gyanvapi case
201.article_body: Reacting to the ongoing Gyanvapi mosque case, Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge said that the matter is in court but status of all mosques, temples, and other spaces of religious worship in 1947 had to be maintained as such. He further said that Places of Worship Act 1991 was made regarding it. A few are trying to divide people, he added.

202.title: Aadhaar card registration camp to be set up for transgenders in Pune
202.article_body: Pune district collector's office along with the Bindu Queer Rights Foundation (BQRF) is set to organise a camp for transgender persons to help them register for their Aadhaar cards. Camp will ensure that persons without necessary documents are also able to apply for their cards, BQRF director Bindumadhav Khire said. "We're...reaching out to people in rural areas of...district," Khire added.

203.title: 3 killed, 25 injured as double-decker bus overturns on Agra-Lucknow Expressway
203.article_body: At least three people were killed and 25 others were severely injured after a double-decker bus overturned on Agra-Lucknow Expressway in Bangarmau area in Uttar Pradesh's Unnao, officials said. The bus was carrying around 80-85 passengers and was on its way to Bihar from Rajasthan, Bangarmau SDM said. As many as 55 passengers sustained minor injuries, the SDM added.

204.title: LIC shares settle at ₹873 on first trading day, down 8% from issue price
204.article_body: The shares of India's largest insurer LIC ended the first day of trading at ₹872.70 on Tuesday, down ₹76.30, or 8.04%, from the issue price. The shares of LIC touched an intraday high of ₹920 and an intraday low of ₹860.10. Shares of LIC got listed at a discount of 8.62% in early trade over the issue price of ₹949.

205.title: Talks with Ukraine are not going on in any form: Russia
205.article_body: Russia and Ukraine are not holding talks "in any form", Russian Deputy Foreign Minister Andrey Rudenko was quoted as saying by the Interfax news agency on Tuesday. "Ukraine has practically withdrawn from the negotiation process," Rudenko added. Russia began invading its neighbour Ukraine on February 24, and since then, thousands of civilians have been killed in the war.

206.title: Nushrratt to play female lead in remake of Prabhas' 'Chatrapathi'
206.article_body: Actress Nushrratt Bharuccha has been roped in to play the female lead in the Hindi remake of Prabhas' 2005 Telugu film 'Chatrapathi'. The upcoming film will also mark the Bollywood debut of Bellamkonda Sreenivas, who will play the lead role. Rajamouli's father Vijayendra Prasad, who wrote the story for the original, has penned the script of the remake as well.

207.title: BJP trying to weaken Congress by raiding its members: Kharge
207.article_body: Congress MP Mallikarjun Kharge said the BJP is trying to weaken Congress by raiding its members. His statement comes as CBI conducted searches at multiple locations of Congress' Karti Chidambaram in connection with an ongoing case. "Chidambaram (Senior Congress leader) is a good lawyer and economist. This is the effect of speeches and debates he participates in," Kharge said.

208.title: 430 kg of tea adulterated with chemical seized in Mumbai, 2 arrested
208.article_body: Mumbai Police have seized 430 kg of adulterated tea worth ₹85,000 from a slum pocket in Mumbai's Sewree and arrested two men. The duo have no licence to sell or stock tea. "They adulterated tea with a chemical to give it a scent and a taste," police said. "Such tea has no benefits...and is harmful to...health," they added.

209.title: Bill Gates lists 3 steps that may ensure COVID-19 is the last pandemic
209.article_body: Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates has said the world needs to work on three key areas to ensure COVID-19 is the last pandemic. He listed investing in better vaccines, therapeutics and diagnostics as first step. Second step is improving disease monitoring, with Gates suggesting creation of GERM (Global Epidemic Response and Mobilization) team. The third key area is strengthening health systems.

210.title: CBI found nothing, timing of search is interesting: P Chidambaram
210.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram on Tuesday said a CBI team searched his residence in Chennai and his official residence in Delhi. "I may point out that the timing of the search is interesting," Chidambaram tweeted. "The team showed me an FIR in which I am not named as an accused. The search team found nothing and seized nothing," Chidambaram added.

211.title: 2 kids die, 15 people fall sick after eating food at wedding in MP
211.article_body: Two children died and 15 other people fell sick due to suspected food poisoning at a marriage function in Madhya Pradesh's Chhindwara, a health official said on Tuesday. A doctor said that some people had complained of vomiting and diarrhoea after eating food at the function. The two children, aged eight and 11, had died during treatment, the doctor added.

212.title: Claiming wife couldn't drape saree, walk properly, man kills self in Maha
212.article_body: A 24-year-old man, reportedly unhappy with his wife, killed himself in Maharashtra's Aurangabad. Bramha Giri, in-charge of Mukundwadi police station, said that a suicide note that was recovered from deceased's room said his wife could not drape a saree, talk or walk properly. Reports said that the man married the woman, six years older than him, six months ago.

213.title: Hezbollah, its allies lose majority in Lebanon’s general elections
213.article_body: Hezbollah and its allies failed to cross the majority mark in the parliamentary elections in Lebanon. According to Reuters, they managed to secure around 62 seats of the total 128, down from the tally of 71 they bagged in the previous elections held in 2018. The results showed that none of the parties got a clear majority.

214.title: Should've happened much earlier: Deepika on being Cannes jury member
214.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone, who will be a jury member at Cannes this year, stated that it should have happened much earlier. "This is where we belong...It took its own time. It's taken generations of work from different people to get us to this place," the actress added. Deepika further said that there is also a sense of gratitude she feels.

215.title: Justin calls out fans who made noise during tribute to Buffalo shooting victims
215.article_body: Singer Justin Bieber called out fans who made noise during a moment of silence at his Buffalo, New York concert, intended to honour the victims of the recent supermarket mass shooting. Sharing a video of the concert, Justin wrote, "To...people who couldn't stay silent to honour the lives that were so tragically lost, I urge you to ask yourself why?"

216.title: Trump to wait for 6 hours before reposting Truth Social content
216.article_body: Ex-US President Donald Trump is obligated to first post to new social network Truth Social and can't publish it on another social media site for six hours, as per a regulatory filing. However, he's still free to post from personal account about political messaging on any platform at any time. Recently, Elon Musk said he'd reverse Trump's ban on Twitter.

217.title: Man cleaning sewer dies after concrete slab falls on him in Delhi
217.article_body: A 55-year-old man died and two others sustained injuries after a portion of a concrete slab of a sewer fell on them while they were cleaning the sewer in Delhi, police said. An injured person has alleged that they were trapped inside the sewer for a while and were pulled out after 20-30 minutes. Meanwhile, police have registered a case.

218.title: Hyd Police to organise free summer camp to bridge gap between kids, police
218.article_body: The Hyderabad Traffic Police on Monday announced that it will be organising a free summer camp for children. Through the camp, the Hyderabad Police aims to bridge the gap between children and police and create traffic awareness amongst them, police said. The camp, to be held at Traffic Training Institute in Hyderabad, will be organised from May 23 to 28.

219.title: Musk's mother Maye becomes oldest woman to pose in swimsuit for Sports Illustrated
219.article_body: Maye Musk, mother of the world's richest man Elon Musk, has become the oldest woman to pose for the cover of Sports Illustrated's Swimsuit issue. The 74-year-old supermodel appeared in the annual swimsuit issue while wearing a one-piece Maygel Coronel suit. "Musk embodies the idea that ageing shouldn't hold you back from pursuing your dreams," wrote Sports Illustrated.

220.title: I'm not named in FIR but CBI searched my house: P Chidambaram after raid on son
220.article_body: Congress MP and former Finance Minister P Chidambaram said that his houses in Chennai and Delhi were searched by the CBI after his son Karti was raided in a bribes-for-visa case. "The team showed me an FIR in which I'm not named as an accused. The...team found nothing and seized nothing...The timing of the search is interesting," said Chidambaram.

221.title: We've been very strong, braved the storm: Shilpa on Raj Kundra's arrest
221.article_body: Actress Shilpa Shetty, on being asked about husband Raj Kundra's arrest, stated that their entire family has "been very strong" and they "braved the storm". Raj was arrested in 2021 in connection with an adult film racket. "Talking about going through a difficult phase...Last two years have not just been difficult for me, but a lot of people," she added.

222.title: Sweden signs application for NATO membership
222.article_body: Swedish Foreign Minister Ann Linde on Tuesday signed an application declaring the country wants to join NATO, ending decades of military neutrality. "It feels like we have taken a decision that's the best for Sweden," Linde said while signing the document amid the Russia-Ukraine war. Finland has also said it will seek membership in the 30-member military alliance.

223.title: No reason to miss my routine: Karti Chidambaram tweets Wordle score after CBI raids
223.article_body: After the CBI raided properties owned by him and his father and former minister P Chidambaram, Karti Chidambaram tweeted his Wordle score and wrote, "No reason to miss out on my daily routine." Referring to the number of times his office has been raided, he wrote, "I've lost count, how many times has it been? Must be a record."

224.title: B'wood people not worthy of being my friends, that needs qualification: Kangana
224.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut, when asked if she has not a single friend in Bollywood, said that people of the industry are not worth being her friends. "That requires qualification," she said, adding, "It's fine if you meet them [people from Bollywood] outside but don't invite them home." She had recently said star kids look weird like "boiled eggs".

225.title: Honey-trapped BJP leader dies by suicide in Bengaluru: Police
225.article_body: A 46-year-old BJP leader reportedly died by suicide after being honey-trapped by a woman he befriended on Facebook in Bengaluru. The deceased spent some private moments with the accused, who allegedly recorded the videos and blackmailed him. She along with two of her aides threatened him to make the videos public, demanding money from him time and again, police said.

226.title: South Africa announce their squad for T20I series against India
226.article_body: South Africa have announced their 16-member squad for the five-match T20I series against India, which will take place in June. Tristan Stubbs, who replaced Tymal Mills in MI squad, has received his maiden Proteas call-up. Further, Wayne Parnell has been selected in the T20I squad for the first time since 2017. The squad will be led by Temba Bavuma.

227.title: Sensex logs best day in over 2 months, jumps 1,345 points to end at 54,318
227.article_body: The BSE Sensex and Nifty logged their best day in more than two months on Tuesday, aided by gains in metal, energy and oil and gas stocks. While the Sensex rallied 1,345 points to end at 54,318, the Nifty jumped 417 points to end at 16,259. It's also the second-best day for Sensex and Nifty over the last fifteen months.

228.title: Neetu shares old pics with Rishi Kapoor as she marks 47 yrs of Khel Khel Mein
228.article_body: Actress Neetu Kapoor recently shared old photos with her husband, late actor Rishi Kapoor. Taking to Instagram Stories, Neetu posted the photos as her and Rishi Kapoor's film 'Khel Khel Mein' completed 47 years. In the first photo, Rishi was seen holding Neetu's cheeks as she had a surprised expression on her face. Neetu captioned it,  "47 years of #khelkhelmein."

229.title: Slogans against PM raised in Malegaon over Gyanvapi Mosque survey
229.article_body: The members of Social Democratic Party of India (SDPI) on Monday staged protests in Maharashtra's Malegaon over the survey conducted at Gyanvapi Mosque complex during which a 'Shivling' was claimed to be found. The protesters raised slogans against PM Narendra Modi. "We are keeping an eye out for any issue and reserve policemen have been kept on standby," said police.

230.title: Rajasthan's Ramgarh Vishdhari Sanctuary notified as tiger reserve
230.article_body: Rajasthan's Ramgarh Vishdhari Sanctuary was notified as India's 52nd tiger reserve on Monday. Taking to Twitter, Union Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav said, "Pleased to note Ramgarh Vishdhari Tiger Reserve has been notified today. The 52nd Reserve of India will conserve biodiversity and bring in ecotourism." After Ranthambore, Sariska and Mukundara, this is Rajasthan's fourth tiger reserve.

231.title: Uttarakhand govt mandates registration for Char Dham Yatra pilgrims
231.article_body: Uttarakhand government on Tuesday mandated registration for the Char Dham Yatra pilgrims before commencing their journey. "The limit of registration has been fixed according to the carrying capacity of various Dhams," the state Tourism Department said. No pilgrim will be allowed to go beyond Rishikesh without registration, the government added. Char Dham Yatra commenced on May 3 this year.

232.title: 78.9% households in West Bengal have bicycles, highest in India: NFHS
232.article_body: About 78.9% of the households in West Bengal have bicycles, the highest in the country, as per the National Family Health Survey (NFHS-5). While the national average is 50.4%, Uttar Pradesh holds the second rank with 75.6% households owning a bicycle, followed by 72.5% in Odisha, survey showed. Meanwhile, Nagaland reported the least number of households with bicycle at 5.5%.

233.title: Alankrita Shrivastava to helm film on murdered Pak social media star Qandeel
233.article_body: Filmmaker Alankrita Shrivastava, who helmed 'Lipstick Under My Burkha', is set to direct a film on Pakistani social media star Qandeel Baloch, who was murdered in an honour killing in 2016. Alankrita, along with producers Vikas Sharma and Sunny Khanna, has acquired the rights to 'The Sensational Life and Death of Qandeel Baloch', a book by Pakistani journalist Sanam Maher.

234.title: 15-yr-old boy stabs classmate over throwing mango seeds in TN school
234.article_body: A 15-year-old boy reportedly stabbed his classmate following an argument over throwing mango seeds in Tamil Nadu's Bannihalli. The boy and his friends were throwing mango seeds at each other in school. When a seed hit the accused's friend, argument broke out between the two. Two days later, the accused stabbed him with knife hidden in his pocket, police said.

235.title: Madras High Court hears case through WhatsApp for the first time
235.article_body: A judge in the Madras High Court took up a case through WhatsApp on a Sunday for the first time. Justice GR Swaminathan heard the case while being stationed at Nagercoil, where he had gone for a wedding. The petitioner had submitted that his village will face the "divine wrath" if a proposed 'Rath' festival was not held on Monday.

236.title: No-confidence motion against Sri Lankan Prez defeated in parliament
236.article_body: A no-confidence motion tabled by Opposition against Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa was defeated in parliament on Tuesday. The motion was moved by Tamil National Alliance lawmaker MA Sumanthiran and was defeated after 119 MPs voted against it, with only 68 MPs voting in its favour. This comes amid protesting citizens' demand for Gotabaya's resignation as country faces economic crisis.

237.title: Ukrainian man escapes after being shot and buried alive by Russian soldiers
237.article_body: A Ukrainian man escaped after being shot in the face and buried alive by Russian soldiers. Mykola, whose two brothers were killed, played dead after the bullet entered his cheek and exited next to his right ear. After escaping, he went to the nearest house, where a woman took him in and cared for him.

238.title: Future yet to be decided on Depp's return in 'Pirates of...': Producer
238.article_body: 'Pirates of the Caribbean' producer Jerry Bruckheimer has opened up if actor Johnny Depp would return to the franchise. He said, "Not at this point. The future is yet to be decided." Talking about the upcoming films in the franchise, Bruckheimer said, "We're talking to Margot Robbie. We are developing two Pirates scripts, one with her, one without."

239.title: Ponting told me to make this opportunity count: Sarfaraz on 32(16) vs PBKS
239.article_body: DC batter Sarfaraz Khan, who scored 32(16) against PBKS, has revealed that coach Ricky Ponting had told him to "make the opportunity count" ahead of the game. He added, "We lost [Warner] on the first ball, [but]...I tried to score as many runs as possible [in powerplay]." DC reached 51/1 when Sarfaraz got out in the fifth over.

240.title: LIC will focus on increasing return for its policyholders: Chairman
240.article_body: LIC will focus on increasing return for its policyholders, said Chairman MR Kumar after the insurer's IPO made its stock market debut on Tuesday. "We will ensure that whatever bonuses [policyholders] have been getting is maintained or even increased. In a couple of years, even though the percentage goes down, the quantum of bonus goes up," he added.

241.title: Was a little unsure at first: Patrick on playing Professor X in 'Doctor...'
241.article_body: Actor Patrick Stewart, speaking about reprising his role of Professor X (Charles Francis Xavier) in 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness', said that he was "a little unsure at first if it was a wise thing to do". However, he added, "Having seen [Doctor Strange 2], I'm very happy and very proud that I've been part of that."

242.title: Chinese immigrant attacked US church over hatred for Taiwan: Authorities
242.article_body: A Chinese immigrant who carried out a shooting at a California church was allegedly motivated by hatred against Taiwan, authorities said. The accused's family was forcibly moved from China to Taiwan sometime after 1948 and authorities said he didn't feel like he was treated well while living in Taiwan. One person was killed and five others were injured in attack.

243.title: Sri Lanka to print money to pay salaries; plans to sell national airline
243.article_body: Sri Lanka's newly inducted PM Ranil Wickremesinghe has said that he has been forced to print money in order to pay salaries amid the nation's worst economic crisis. The government also plans to sell its national airline to cut losses and stabilise the nation's finances. Sri Lankan Airlines lost $124 million in the year ending March 2021.

244.title: Raj Kapoor had stacks of Archie comics in his bathroom, dressing room: Boney
244.article_body: Film Producer Boney Kapoor said that late actor Raj Kapoor was a big fan of 'Archie' and would always have latest edition of the comic. "He used to have stacks of Archie comics in his bathroom and dressing room...When we were young...one of the attractions for me visiting Raj uncle's house was getting to read...the latest Archie comics," he added.

245.title: MI free from pressure now, they should express themselves: Ojha
245.article_body: Ex-India spinner Pragyan Ojha has said MI players should express themselves in their remaining matches in IPL 2022 as they can't qualify for the playoffs and there's "no pressure".  He added, "Players like Ishan Kishan and Rohit Sharma should look to regain their form." Currently, MI are at the bottom of IPL standings after losing nine of their 12 games.

246.title: Sector 46 residents protest against power cuts in Gurugram
246.article_body: A group of residents of Gurugram's Sector 46 and adjoining areas protested against power outages in the area. The residents complained that misery caused by the power cuts has been exacerbated by the severe heat wave. "The only solution to...power problem in this sector requires upgrading of infrastructure," RK Yadav, the President of Sector 46 Residents Welfare Association (RWA), said.

247.title: SC extends deadline for demolition of Noida's Supertech twin towers to Aug 28
247.article_body: The Supreme Court (SC) on Tuesday extended the deadline for demolition of Supertech's twin towers in Noida to August 28. The court order came after an application moved by Supertech sought extension of the deadline for the demolition, which was scheduled on May 22. The SC has directed Noida Authority to file a status report on compliance of the order.

248.title: What is the Places of Worship Act & how is it linked to Gyanvapi Mosque case?
248.article_body: The Places of Worship (Special Provisions) Act, 1991 prohibits conversion of any place of worship as it existed on August 15, 1947. The committee that has challenged the video survey of Gyanvapi Mosque in the Supreme Court has cited the Act in its appeal. The Act prohibits the survey of the Hindu shrine in the mosque, the plea said.

249.title: Fought hard to stay in 'Aquaman 2' but they reduced my role: Amber Heard
249.article_body: Amber Heard, while being cross-examined during Johnny Depp's defamation trial, revealed the makers of 'Aquaman and the Lost Kingdom' didn't want her in the film due to negative publicity. "I fought...hard to stay in the movie," Amber said while adding that her role was reduced in the new scripts she received. "They...took a bunch out of my role," she added.

250.title: Centre opposes plea for live streaming of same-sex marriage hearing
250.article_body: The Centre has told the Delhi High Court that it opposes the plea to live stream the proceedings of a case related to same-sex marriages, saying that it was "aimed at creation of a dramatic impression of the proceedings and to win sympathy". The case doesn't involve a fundamental right violation and is "not of national importance", it added.

251.title: Bengaluru man cheats 4 of ₹78 lakh, loses money in cricket betting
251.article_body: A 28-year-old Bengaluru-based man allegedly cheated four persons of ₹78 lakh after luring them into investing in his business, police said. He was arrested and his four family members, including his mother and sister, have been booked in this connection. During interrogation, he revealed he had lost all the money he took from victims in online games and cricket betting.

252.title: MI should rest Rohit, Bumrah, push Kishan down the order: Manjrekar
252.article_body: Commentator Sanjay Manjrekar said bottom-placed MI should rest captain Rohit Sharma and pacer Jasprit Bumrah and give young players an opportunity to play as they're out of the playoffs race in IPL 2022. He added that Ishan Kishan should bat down the order. "Now they've just got to plan for the future and look at other options," he further said.

253.title: Raj Thackeray on 2-day visit to Pune amid Hanuman Chalisa row
253.article_body: MNS chief Raj Thackeray is on a two-day visit to Pune from Tuesday onwards to meet party leaders, a worker confirmed. Thackeray's visit comes amid the removal of MNS corporator Vasant More from his designation of MNS' Pune unit chief after latter refused to play Hanuman Chalisa in front of mosques. Thackeray is also slated to visit Ayodhya in June.

254.title: PM inaugurates IIT Madras-led India's first 5G testbed costing ₹220 crore
254.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday inaugurated India's first 5G testbed developed indigenously in a collaborative project by eight institutes led by IIT Madras. The 5G testbed will enable startups and industry players to test and validate their products locally and reduce dependence on foreign facilities. It has been set up at a cost of around ₹220 crore.

255.title: Thrilled to lend my voice to Kangana; she was high on my list: Nikhita Gandhi
255.article_body: Singer Nikhita Gandhi said she had the opportunity to sing for "such gorgeous and powerful women" in the industry. She added, "Kangana is of course somebody who's very high on that list and somebody I wanted to sing for." "I was...thrilled to be able to lend my voice to her and she looks...ravishing in the video," Nikhita said.

256.title: Amber Heard hit Johnny Depp but it was not abuse: Julia Fox
256.article_body: Actress Julia Fox has made an Instagram comment, writing that Amber Heard hit her ex-husband Johnny Depp but it was not abuse. "You need to have power to be able to abuse it. She was 25. He...was always...more powerful...physically and financially," Julia wrote. Depp is suing Amber for defamation following her op-ed claiming to be a victim of sexual violence.

257.title: Mumbai woman tries to book helicopter rides to Kedarnath online, cheated
257.article_body: A woman from Mumbai, who was trying to book tickets online for helicopter rides for 19 people to Uttarakhand's Kedarnath, was cheated by a cyber fraudster. The fraudster, impersonating an agent, allegedly tricked her into transferring ₹2.87 lakh. The accused allegedly made the woman send her Aadhaar and PAN card details, following which money got deducted from her account.

258.title: Gyanvapi Temple, 'jyotirling' mentioned in 'Puranas': Kashi Temple Trust chief
258.article_body: Shri Kashi Vishwanath Temple Trust Council President Nagendra Pandey has claimed that the 'Puranas' (Hindu scriptures) clearly mention in detail about Gyanvapi Temple and the presence of a 'jyotirling' in it. "There is no doubt that the present day Gyanvapi Mosque was a part of the temple complex mentioned in our scriptures," said Pandey.

259.title: Kejriwal lied about 24-hr power supply in Delhi: Tiwari as he visits inverter shops
259.article_body: After Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal claimed that inverter shops were closed in the national capital due to 24-hour power supply, BJP MP Manoj Tiwari visited shops selling inverters to "fact-check" the remark and shared videos of the same. He alleged that Kejriwal "lied" when the latter made the comment in Kerala. "AAP people only tell lies," Tiwari also claimed.

260.title: Who is new Bengaluru Police Commissioner CH Pratap Reddy?
260.article_body: CH Pratap Reddy, the Additional Director General of Police of the Law and Order Department, has been appointed the new Bengaluru Police Commissioner, replacing Kamal Pant. Reddy, a 1991 batch officer, is known for his work in cyber security. He was deputed with the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) in Bengaluru and headed its Anti-Corruption Branch in Mumbai.

261.title: DU councils' members write to VC against College of Art
261.article_body: Members of Delhi University's (DU) Executive Council (EC) and Academic Council (AC) have written to their vice-chancellor over College of Art (CoA) starting its admission process as part of Delhi University. The members have claimed that despite EC having refused de-affiliation of CoA from Delhi University, the college had started its admission process as part of Ambedkar University Delhi (AUD).

262.title: Major cities like London, Delhi face increasing danger of drought: Report
262.article_body: Major world cities including London, New Delhi, Beijing, etc. are facing an increased danger of drought, the Christian Aid report has warned. The report stated that these cities are running out of freshwater resources due to growing population and climate change. Experts said that the intensity and frequency of droughts have increased over last 30 years due to global warming.

263.title: Delhi woman cheated of ₹15 lakh by man she met on matrimonial site
263.article_body: Delhi Police have arrested a man for allegedly cheating a woman of ₹15 lakh by posing as a UK-based divorcee on a matrimonial site. Reportedly, he used to send her expensive gifts through courier. Subsequently, one day the woman transferred ₹15 lakh to different accounts under the pretext of "excise duty" to receive gifts sent by him, but got cheated.

264.title: Tomato prices rise up to ₹60 per kg in Pune
264.article_body: Prices of tomatoes in Pune have risen up to ₹60 per kg due to factors like unseasonal rain in some tomato producing areas, rising temperatures and transport costs. The prices of several other vegetables have also witnessed a rise. The prices of tomatoes rose to ₹40 per kg during this period last year.

265.title: Bharti Singh booked for allegedly hurting sentiments of Sikh community in viral video
265.article_body: An FIR has been lodged against comedian Bharti Singh over an old video in which she allegedly mocked men with beards. The FIR was registered in Punjab's Amritsar on Monday night on the complaint of the Shiromani Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee, which alleged that she had hurt the sentiments of Sikhs. After the clip went viral, Bharti had issued an apology.

266.title: SEBI proposes banning celebrities from promoting crypto products
266.article_body: SEBI has recommended that no prominent public figures, including celebrities and sportspersons, should endorse crypto products. It added that firms advertising cryptos and digital assets should put up disclosures listing out the possible law violations. This comes after the Advertising Standards Council of India (ASCI) in February said crypto ads must carry a prominent and unmissable disclaimer.

267.title: More than 1 lakh people disappeared amid Mexico's drug war
267.article_body: More than one lakh people have "disappeared" in Mexico since 1964, the government data showed as families urged the government to carry out more effective searches and investigations. Organised crime is among the leading causes of missing people in the country, the UN said. Cases of disappearances have spiked since 2006 after then-president Felipe Calderon began a war against drugs.

268.title: North Korea reports 1.48 mn 'fever' cases amid COVID-19 outbreak, deploys army
268.article_body: North Korea has reported 1.48 million cases of 'fever', while 56 people have died amid a nationwide outbreak of COVID-19, the country's anti-virus headquarters said. The country's leader Kim Jong-un has deployed a 'powerful force' of the army to all pharmacies in Pyongyang. At least 663,910 people are under quarantine in North Korea.

269.title: We've felt support, it's hard but we're not alone: Sam on Britney's miscarriage
269.article_body: American singer-songwriter Britney Spears' fiancé Sam Asghari took to Instagram to say that the couple has felt the support of their fans after Britney's miscarriage. "We are taking things positively and moving forward with our future. It's hard but we are not alone. Thank you for respecting our privacy. We will be expanding our family soon," he wrote.

270.title: KTR has disturbed mindset: T'gana BJP leader over remarks against Amit Shah
270.article_body: Telangana BJP Vice President NVSS Prabhakar criticised Minister KT Rama Rao for calling Union Minister Amit Shah a "Liar's Badshah". "He is a man of the masses, calling him a liar shows the disturbed mindset of KTR," Prabhakar said. He further alleged that Telangana government has "cheated on Dalits" by not giving them three acres of land as promised earlier.

271.title: KKR share farewell video after Ajinkya Rahane ruled out of remaining matches of IPL 2022
271.article_body: KKR took to social media to share a farewell video for Ajinkya Rahane, who has been ruled out of remaining matches of IPL 2022. "Guys...I really enjoyed my time, on and off the field with everyone. Learnt a lot as a cricketer, about life, about everything," Rahane said in the video. The video contained moments of Rahane from the tournament.

272.title: We are still a poor country, to be honest: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath
272.article_body: Online stockbroker Zerodha's billionaire CEO Nithin Kamath told Moneycontrol, "I don't think there's an opportunity to build many $100 million valuation businesses in India because we are still a poor country, to be honest." He added, "There cannot be 1,000 companies with a $100 million valuation because that would mean them having at least $10 million revenue."

273.title: Mumbai account officer clicks on link to update PAN card, loses ₹1.80 lakh
273.article_body: A 34-year-old woman, who is an account officer in Mumbai, lost ₹1.80 lakh after she clicked on link sent to her for updating her PAN card. The woman said that a fake HDFC bank page opened when she clicked on the link, after which, she was asked to enter her user ID and password. An FIR was registered in case.

274.title: De Villiers, Gayle inducted into RCB Hall of Fame; franchise shares pics of their medals
274.article_body: RCB have introduced their Hall of Fame, with Chris Gayle and AB de Villiers becoming the first two players to be inducted into it. De Villiers played for RCB from 2011 to 2021, while Chris Gayle represented the franchise from 2011 to 2017. RCB also shared pictures of the Hall of Fame medals to be given to the duo.

275.title: India should be ready to launch 6G services in 10 years: PM Modi
275.article_body: PM Narendra Modi has said that India should be ready to launch 6G services in the next 10 years, adding that a task force has already started work on it. The 5G technology will contribute $450 billion to India's economy in the next decade and a half, PM added. He said India is today the "world's biggest mobile manufacturing hub."

276.title: India came out of 2G era of corruption, moving towards 5G & 6G: PM
276.article_body: India came out of the "corruption" and "policy paralysis" of 2G era and rapidly moved from 3G to 4G and now 5G and 6G, PM Narendra Modi said on Tuesday. "Our telecom sector is a great example of how self-reliance and healthy competition create a multiplier effect in society and economy," PM added.

277.title: 435 PMAY houses in TN's Pudukkottai never built, exist only in files: Probe
277.article_body: At least 435 houses under Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (PMAY) were never built in the Avudaiyarkoil block in Tamil Nadu's Pudukkottai, as per an investigation by district administration. The government paid beneficiaries the eligible amount but the houses exist only in files. The matter came to light following a complaint claiming several houses were not built but payments were made.

278.title: Was really nervous when I got back on stage after 2 years: Pankaj Udhas
278.article_body: Veteran singer Pankaj Udhas has said he was very nervous when he performed live on stage after a gap of two years. "Before...pandemic, there used to be a lot of confidence in me before any concert. But pandemic phase was tough, even psychologically," he said, adding, "Though I did my riyaaz regularly...there was a lack of exposure to...stage and audience."

279.title: Amit Shah reviews security preparedness for Amarnath Yatra
279.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday held a high-level meeting to review the security preparedness for the Amarnath Yatra, scheduled to begin from June 30. J&K LG Manoj Sinha and Union Home Secretary Ajay Kumar Bhalla were among the officials who attended the meeting. Shri Amarnathji Shrine Board members also participated in the meeting via video conferencing.

280.title: Low-floor Kerala buses not in usable condition to be turned into classrooms
280.article_body: Kerala Transport Minister Antony Raju said that the low-floor buses in the state that are not in a condition to be put back on roads after the pandemic will be converted into classrooms. "We felt let it be a new experience for kids," he said, adding that the request for the initiative came from state Education Minister V Sivankutty.

281.title: Williamson doesn't get out, keeps wasting balls: Piyush Chalwa
281.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Piyush Chawla has said SRH should drop their captain Kane Williamson for the remainder of IPL 2022. "Abhishek Sharma is batting really well but he isn't getting the support of Williamson. He tries to play the big shots [but] Williamson takes up so many deliveries, he doesn't get out and keeps wasting deliveries," stated Chawla.

282.title: Govt relaxes wheat export ban, to allow export of consignments registered before May 13
282.article_body: The government on Tuesday announced relaxations to its order banning wheat exports. "It's been decided that wherever wheat consignments have been handed over to customs for examination and registered into their systems on or prior to May 13, such consignments would be allowed for export," the Ministry of Commerce and Industry said in a statement.

283.title: Over 1,100 kg ganja seized from truck along Assam-Tripura border, 2 arrested
283.article_body: Assam Police on Monday seized 1,183 kg of ganja from a truck along the Assam-Tripura border and arrested two persons. The police seized the drugs after intercepting a goods carrier truck coming from Tripura at around 11 pm on Monday, said Niranjan Das, Officer-in-Charge of Churaibari watch post. The apprehended individuals are aged 20 and 18 years.

284.title: 2 BJP MLAs, others booked for 'arms training camp' in Karnataka school
284.article_body: Karnataka Police registered a complaint against two BJP MLAs, a Bajrang Dal leader, a Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) leader and others in connection with an 'arms training camp' organised in a school in Kodagu. Bajrang Dal and VHP organise such camps every year however, no permission was sought this year, police said. Weapons including 'trishul' were distributed at the camp.

285.title: Paytm Mall's valuation drops nearly 100% after Ant Group & Alibaba exit firm
285.article_body: Vijay Shekhar Sharma-led Paytm Mall saw a nearly 100% decline in its valuation after its early investors Alibaba and Ant Group exited the company. Sharma on Monday announced that Paytm Mall's business will now be built on Open Network for Digital Commerce.  The company is now valued at $13 million against its peak valuation of $3 billion in 2020.

286.title: Twitter deal cannot move forward until CEO shows proof of spam accounts data: Musk
286.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Tuesday said the Twitter deal cannot move forward until CEO Parag Agrawal shows proof of spam accounts data. Musk wrote, "20% fake/spam accounts, while 4 times what Twitter claims...My offer was based on Twitter’s SEC filings being accurate...Twitter's CEO publicly refused to show proof of <5%. This deal cannot move forward until he does."

287.title: Was scary with vans shaking, black out: Manushi on sand storm during Prithviraj
287.article_body: Actress Manushi Chhillar said there was a sand storm during the shoot of 'Prithviraj'. "I was on top of a sand dune...I could see them [crew] waving and shouting...Suddenly someone...pushed me down and I literally rolled down the sand dune...It was a little scary when the sand-storm blew over us, with vans shaking and a black out," she added.

288.title: Hyd Traffic Police, GHMC remove silt from drains; pics surface
288.article_body: Hyderabad Traffic Police on Monday shared pictures of it removing silt from catch pits or stormwater drains in multiple areas of the district, in coordination with the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC). The drains were at waterlogging points at Bahadurpura roads, Hanuman temple, Gurudwara road and Akshaya Hotel, it said. "Thank you for the great work," a Twitter user said.

289.title: India responds after Pakistan passes resolution on delimitation exercise in J&K
289.article_body: India has responded after National Assembly of Pakistan passed a resolution on the subject of the delimitation exercise in J&K. "We categorically reject the farcical resolution," Ministry of External Affairs said. "Pakistan has no locus standi to pronounce on or interfere in matters that are internal to India, including the Indian territories under Pakistan's illegal...occupation," it added.

290.title: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh launches INS Surat, INS Udaygiri in Mumbai
290.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh launched the Indian Navy destroyer warship INS Surat and frigate INS Udaygiri in Mumbai on Tuesday. "I shall be in Mumbai to attend the landmark event in the history of indigenous warship building when two frontline @indiannavy warships...will be launched concurrently at MDL," Singh had written on Twitter earlier. He had also shared pictures on Twitter.

291.title: UNICEF warns of 'catastrophic' child malnutrition due to Ukraine war
291.article_body: UNICEF said severe malnutrition in children could go to "catastrophic levels" due to the Russia-Ukraine war and pandemic disruptions. Soaring food prices caused by the war are set to drive up the cost of "life-saving" therapeutic food treatment, it added. Around 13.6 million children under five suffer from severe wasting, a condition where children are too thin for their height.

292.title: Who doesn't like glamour: Boney on daughter Khushi's decision to enter B'wood
292.article_body: Producer Boney Kapoor spoke about his thoughts on the acting debut of his daughter, Khushi Kapoor. "Kids don't come out with their true ambitions right from the start. They start by saying, 'I want to do modelling'," he said. "When they cross the age of 19-20, the thought that they want to act develops firmly...Who doesn't like glamour?" he added.

293.title: He's 50/50, we'll know in a few days: Pant on Prithvi Shaw's availability
293.article_body: DC opener Rishabh Pant, on being asked about the fitness status of Prithvi Shaw, said, "I think he's 50/50. We'll know in a few days." Shaw, who has now missed DC's last four games due to typhoid, last played against the LSG on May 1. The 22-year-old was discharged from the hospital ahead of DC's game against PBKS on Monday.

294.title: Japan to conduct 'test tourism' before full reopening
294.article_body: Japan on Tuesday announced that it will allow small group tours for limited foreigners and assess them as test cases before taking a call on full reopening. The country will allow tourists from the United States, Australia, Thailand and Singapore, who have been triple-vaccinated against COVID-19. The groups will be accompanied by tour conductors at all times.

295.title: Govt to train 20,000 J&K govt officials in grievance redressal: Union Minister
295.article_body: The Centre will train 20,000 J&K government officials in grievance redressal and the task will be undertaken by its Department of Administrative Reforms and Public Grievances, Union Minister Jitendra Singh said. PM Narendra Modi has accorded the top priority in bringing the overall development in J&K and the Centre is committed to raising living standards of its citizens, he added.

296.title: 59-yr-old trader attacked, robbed of ₹50 lakh cash in Chhattisgarh
296.article_body: A 59-year-old food grain trader was attacked and robbed of ₹50 lakh cash in Chhattisgarh's Raipur. The incident occurred on Monday night when the victim, identified as Narendra Khetrapal, was returning home on his scooter after closing his shop, police said. Khetrapal suffered head injuries in the attack, following which he was admitted to the hospital, police added.

297.title: Live-in couple found dead in rented flat in Gurugram's Sushant Lok
297.article_body: The Gurugram Police found bodies of a live-in couple, both aged 29 years, inside their rented apartment in Sushant Lok Phase 1 area. Police said that they found the man hanging and the woman lying on the bed in the same room. The man was a chef by profession and the woman worked at a food chain outlet in Gurugram.

298.title: Mike Tyson joins Sean Penn, Tye Sheridan in thriller 'Black Flies'
298.article_body: Former American boxer Mike Tyson is set to star in 'Black Flies', an upcoming thriller drama based on Shannon Burke's novel of the same name. He'll be seen sharing screen space with Sean Penn, Tye Sheridan and Katherine Waterston in the film, which will be directed by Jean-Stéphane Sauvaire. Tyson will also make a cameo appearance in Vijay Deverakonda's 'Liger'.

299.title: Tara Sharma, Koel Purie to play mothers to Agastya & Suhana in 'The Archies'
299.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan's daughter Suhana Khan and Amitabh Bachchan's grandson Agastya Nanda will be making their debut with Zoya Akhtar's film 'The Archies'. Actresses Koel Purie and Tara Sharma will play their mothers respectively. Tara had earlier made her debut in Anupam Kher's 'Om Jai Jagadish' as Abhishek Bachchan's wife, while Koel Purie starred in 'The Zoya Factor'.

300.title: Imran Khan's mobile phones stolen after recording video threat: Aide
300.article_body: Two mobile phones of ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan were stolen after he claimed to have made a video clip containing names of all those allegedly plotting to assassinate him, a key aide of Khan said. However, the phones didn't contain Khan's video statement, Dr Shahbaz Gill added. Gill alleged that the phones were stolen at the Sialkot airport on Saturday.

301.title: Ratan Tata shares pics of fake FB page in his name, says 'will take legal action'
301.article_body: Ratan Tata took to Instagram to share screenshots of a fake Facebook page titled 'Ratan Tata Foundation'. He wrote, "This fraudulent page that has been scamming innocent citizens, using the names of my colleagues for money in exchange for help...We don't accept any funds in any form." He added that strict legal action will be taken against the page.

302.title: I resonate with Agni's violent nature & courage: Kangana on 'Dhaakad' role
302.article_body: Kangana Ranaut, speaking about her character agent Agni in movie 'Dhaakad', said, "My character Agni is someone who works for...country, and I also love my country." "I'm an artist, and she's a spy. I resonate with her violent nature and courage...I'd have been a good IPS officer or armed forces officer. I've that kind of...fighting spirit in me," Kangana added.

303.title: I like to perform in crunch times: DC's Shardul Thakur on 4/36 vs PBKS
303.article_body: DC all-rounder Shardul Thakur, who was named Man of the Match for his performance against PBKS, has said he likes to perform during the "crunch times". He added, "The last two games were important and I always feel happy when I rise to the right occasion." Thakur registered figures of 4-0-36-4 in their match against PBKS.

304.title: As Delhi reels under heatwave, hospitals see spike in heat-related ailments
304.article_body: As Delhi is reeling under severe heatwave, hospitals in the national capital reported a noticeable spike in heat-related ailments. Doctors said these patients, who reported symptoms like dehydration, cramps, dizziness and fluctuations in blood pressure, mostly include women and senior citizens. People who stay out for longer durations are at greater risk of developing such symptoms, they added.

305.title: 54-yr-old man chasing phone thief gets hit by train, dies in MP
305.article_body: A 54-year-old man died in Madhya Pradesh's Shahdol after being hit by a train while chasing a phone thief, police said on Tuesday. The deceased was travelling on a train when a person allegedly asked for his phone to make a call, an official said. Later, the person started running away with phone when the train slowed, the official added.

306.title: Probe Mamata Banerjee's nephew in coal theft case in Kolkata: SC to ED
306.article_body: Supreme Court has directed the Enforcement Directorate (ED) to probe West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's nephew and Trinamool Congress leader Abhishek Banerjee and his wife in the coal theft case in Kolkata instead of Delhi. SC added that it would not tolerate any kind of obstruction by the state machinery if ED interrogates Banerjee and his wife in Kolkata.

307.title: Woman found dead in Noida had filed rape complaint in U'khand: Police
307.article_body: A 47-year-old woman, found dead in Noida's Sector 137 on May 11, had lodged a rape complaint against one of her neighbours in Uttarakhand's Ranikhet, police said. The woman had been missing since May 9, police added. "On May 5, she boarded a bus to Ranikhet...On May 7, she went to a local police station...lodged an FIR," police stated.

308.title: 21-yr-old Kannada TV actress Chethana Raj dies after 'fat-free' plastic surgery in B'luru
308.article_body: Kannada TV actress Chethana Raj passed away after undergoing a 'fat-free' plastic surgery at a private hospital in Bengaluru. The 21-year-old actress faced post-surgery complications as fluid began to accumulate in her lungs. According to her father, she went for the surgery without informing them. Her parents have lodged a police complaint against the hospital authorities for negligence.

309.title: Viral video shows teachers teaching Hindi and Urdu at the same time in Bihar classroom
309.article_body: A viral video shows two teachers teaching Hindi and Urdu at the same time in a Bihar classroom. In the video, another teacher is seen trying to pacify the students by banging a stick on her desk. "Our school does not have enough classrooms and this is the reason we teach students in a single room," the Hindi teacher said.

310.title: Chinese PM tells Pak counterpart to punish Karachi blast culprits
310.article_body: Chinese Premier Li Keqiang on Monday asked Pakistani PM Shehbaz Sharif to ensure punishment for those responsible for the blast at Karachi University in which three Chinese teachers were killed. During a telephonic conversation, Keqiang told Sharif that China is shocked and outraged by the attack. Keqiang further called for enhanced security measures for Chinese institutions and citizens.

311.title: Appeal filed in SC against Delhi HC's split verdict on criminalising marital rape
311.article_body: An appeal has been filed in Supreme Court against Delhi HC's split verdict on criminalising marital rape. HC had heard petitions challenging the exception to IPC Section 375, which exempts forced sexual intercourse by a man with his wife, from the offence of rape. One of the judges had held the exception unconstitutional while another had said it wasn't unconstitutional.

312.title: 'Jannat' was the best birthday gift I ever got: Sonal on 14 yrs of film
312.article_body: Sonal Chauhan, who made her debut in 2008 with 'Jannat', spoke about the film which completed 14 years of its release on Monday, on the occasion of her birthday. "Jannat was the best birthday gift I ever got...It coincidentally released on my birthday so yes, I'd say it was the most memorable birthday," she said, adding, "It'll always be...very special."

313.title: Doctor booked for blackmailing, raping tuition teacher in Lucknow
313.article_body: A well-known doctor in Lucknow has been booked for allegedly raping and blackmailing a tuition teacher. The teacher, who used to visit the doctor's place to provide tuition classes to his children, alleged that the accused morphed her photos, blackmailed her and sexually assaulted her for several months. He allegedly forced her to consume abortion pills when she became pregnant.

314.title: India's wholesale inflation surges to record 15.08% in April, up from 14.55% in Mar
314.article_body: India’s Wholesale Price Index (WPI) surged to a record high of 15.08% in April from 14.55% in March, according to the data released by the commerce ministry. As per the data released by the Centre on May 12, India’s retail inflation rose to 7.79% in April 2022, the highest since May 2014.

315.title: Hope India would reconsider its decision to ban wheat exports: US
315.article_body: US Ambassador to the UN Linda Thomas-Greenfield has said that the US hopes India would reconsider its decision to ban wheat exports. "We have seen the report of India's decision. We're encouraging countries not to restrict exports because we think any restrictions on exports will exacerbate the food shortages," she added. India is world's second-biggest wheat producer.

316.title: Process all Green Cards within 6 months: US presidential advisory commission
316.article_body: The President's Advisory Commission on Asian Americans, Native Hawaiians, and Pacific Islanders has unanimously voted to recommend US President Joe Biden to process all applications for Green Cards within six months. If adopted, it will benefit thousands of Indian-Americans and those waiting, some even for decades, for a Green Card. The recommendations now require White House's approval.

317.title: No cars sold in Shanghai in April due to COVID-19 restrictions
317.article_body: In China's Shanghai, home to 25 million residents, no cars were sold last month after dealerships were shut due to tight COVID-19 restrictions. It was the worst April sales' record in a decade, said the China Association of Automobile Manufacturers. China has imposed strict restrictions as it fights the largest COVID-19 outbreak in over two years.

318.title: Attempt to transform Gyanvapi mosque into temple is a conspiracy: AIMPLB
318.article_body: The All India Muslim Personal Law Board (AIMPLB) criticised the sealing of the pond (wazu khana) in the Gyanvapi Masjid complex and said, "Gyanvapi is a mosque and will remain a mosque." "The attempt to transform it into a temple is nothing more than a conspiracy to spread hate by communal forces," AIMPLB General Secretary Maulana Khalid Saifullah Rahmani said.

319.title: Saw bodies piled up, they had no way to leave: Official on Mundka fire
319.article_body: MK Chattopadhyay, a fire divisional officer at the Delhi Fire Service, said when fire fighters entered the building where fire broke out on May 13 near Mundka metro station, they saw that the goods were gutted and the chairs were hollow. "[We saw] bodies piled up near...door of...second floor...They had no way to leave...If only there was...second exit," he added.

320.title: IMD predicts moderate rainfall over Bengaluru for next 4 days
320.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted moderate rainfall over Bengaluru for the next four days. This comes after rainfall on Monday lashed the city leading to traffic jams and waterlogging in some parts. The IMD has also issued an 'orange' alert for Bengaluru for Tuesday and Wednesday, along with a 'yellow' alert for coastal areas of Karnataka for Tuesday.

321.title: Day after going missing, 25-yr-old banker found 'murdered' in Ludhiana
321.article_body: A 25-year-old banker was found "murdered" in Ludhiana’s Salaudi village on Monday, a day after he went missing. His body had multiple injuries. The victim’s father claimed that the "murder" was pre-planned. The police are suspecting an old rivalry as the motive behind the killing and the victim’s call history is also being scanned, a police official said.

322.title: Badi amma will be the epitome of brilliance: Sara on Sharmila's comeback film
322.article_body: Veteran actor Sharmila Tagore is set to make a comeback with 'Gulmohar'. Taking to Instagram Story, actress Sara Ali Khan shared the poster of the film and wrote a note for her grandmother. She said, "Badi amma is back on screen. To watch her, I am truly keen. She will be the epitome of brilliance and grace, I have yakeen."

323.title: McDonald's looking to sell its restaurants to a local buyer in Russia
323.article_body: McDonald's is looking to sell its restaurants to a local buyer in Russia after it announced its exit from the country after 30 years of operation. However, it won't allow stores to use its name, logo, branding and menu. It also said it would ensure its 62,000 employees in Russia continue to be paid until the closure of any transaction.

324.title: J&K police bust Lashkar-e-Taiba terror module in Bandipora; 7 held
324.article_body: At least seven people, including terrorists and their associates, were arrested in Jammu and Kashmir's Bandipora after police busted a Lashkar-e-Taiba terror module, a police spokesperson said. Two of those arrested are hybrid terrorists who were tasked with carrying out attacks on security forces in the area, the spokesperson added. Incriminating material, arms and ammunition were also seized.

325.title: My parents are thrilled to be grandparents of 4 granddaughters: Nick Jonas
325.article_body: American singer-songwriter Nick Jonas, who is married to actress Priyanka Chopra, said that his parents are thrilled to be grandparents of four beautiful granddaughters. While talking about his newborn daughter Malti Marie, Nick said, "She's a gift and we're just so blessed." He added that the Jonas family keeps growing and there are a lot of girls.

326.title: Withdraw charges against doctors over kidney transplant malpractice: IMA Pune
326.article_body: Indian Medical Association's (IMA) Pune unit has sought the withdrawal of charges filed against Ruby Hall Clinic's doctors and management in kidney transplant malpractice case. "How can doctors be involved in checking...marriage documents once they're authorised by government agencies?" IMA Pune chief Meenakshi Deshpande said. A woman had allegedly posed as the wife of a man who needed transplant.

327.title: Police kill one more accused involved in killing of policemen in MP's Guna
327.article_body: One of the persons accused of killing three policemen in MP's Guna district last week was killed in an encounter on Tuesday morning. The encounter took place in a forest near Haripura village, police said. With this, three accused have so far been killed and four others arrested, police stated, adding that two of the accused are still absconding.

328.title: Situation in J&K improved due to synergy among forces: Lt Gen Dwivedi
328.article_body: Lieutenant General Upendra Dwivedi, GOC-in-C, Northern Command said due to an “extraordinary” synergy among security forces, the situation in J&K has seen “tremendous” improvement since August 2019. “There has been a considerable improvement in all parameters of terrorism and violence,” Lt Gen Dwivedi added. This has led to frustration among the terrorist leadership, he stated.

329.title: What led to baby formula shortage in US?
329.article_body: The baby formula shortage in the US can be traced back to a contamination problem at an Abbott factory that produces much of the Similac formula for the US market. Abbott voluntarily shut down the factory in February, amid consumer complaints. In addition to this, general supply-chain problems for the formula ingredients and packaging also led to the shortage.

330.title: Investors lose ₹42,500 crore within minutes of LIC listing at 9% discount
330.article_body: Investors lost over ₹42,500 crore in minutes on Tuesday after LIC's market capitalisation slipped to ₹5.57 lakh crore in early trade against over ₹6 lakh crore at the issue price. The stock was listed at ₹867 on the BSE, which is an 8.64% discount from its IPO price of ₹949. On NSE, it debuted at a discount of 8.11%.

331.title: G7's attempts to isolate Moscow make global food crisis worse: Russia
331.article_body: Russia said the attempts by the West, "primarily from the Group of Seven", to isolate Moscow have worsened global food shortages. G7 foreign ministers on Saturday had promised to reinforce Russia's economic, political isolation and work to ease food shortages stemming from Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Before war, Ukraine and Russia together accounted for about 29% of global wheat exports.

332.title: Uttar Pradesh on alert as dengue cases rise alarmingly
332.article_body: Health officials are on alert as dengue cases in Uttar Pradesh are rising. Though the state has required medical infrastructure to counter an outbreak, there's no medicine or vaccine for dengue, so efforts should be made to prevent it, health officials said. The state has 70 labs with dengue testing facilities and fever health desks at every hospital, they added.

333.title: Electric bus service at Pune's Sinhagad Fort suspended indefinitely
333.article_body: Pune administration indefinitely suspended its electric bus service at Sinhagad Fort from Tuesday. "The administration has been asked to suspend the special bus service from the foothill of Sinhagad Fort to the top till all issues related to safe travel are resolved," Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar said. The special bus service was launched on May 1.

334.title: Taliban dissolves Afghanistan's Human Rights Commission, calls it 'unnecessary'
334.article_body: Taliban authorities in Afghanistan dissolved five key departments, including the country's Human Rights Commission and the National Security Council, calling them "unnecessary". As Afghanistan faces a budget deficit of 44 billion Afghanis ($501 million) this financial year, Taliban authorities said, "These departments were not included in the budget and they have been dissolved."

335.title: Congress facing phobia of regional parties: HD Kumaraswamy
335.article_body: Reacting to Rahul Gandhi's remark that regional parties cannot fight the BJP-RSS as they lack ideology, ex-Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy said that Congress is facing a "phobia of regional parties". "Congress has lost its identity in Andhra, Telangana, Odisha and other states. In Karnataka, the Congress is nearing its end," the Janata Dal (Secular) leader added.

336.title: Credit for our win vs PBKS goes to bowlers, they were outstanding: Marsh
336.article_body: DC's Mitchell Marsh said the credit for their win against PBKS goes to the bowlers as they were outstanding in restricting the Mayank Agarwal-led side to 142/9. "It's been one of those seasons where we've been stop-start. It's about peaking at the right time," he added. Marsh scored 63(48), while DC's Shardul Thakur took four wickets in the match.

337.title: 3 BJP workers booked for assaulting women NCP members in Pune
337.article_body: Pune Police has booked three BJP workers for allegedly assaulting women workers of Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) at a book-release event on Monday. As per FIR, the women had gone to the auditorium to give a memorandum to Union Minister Smriti Irani over rising inflation and LPG price hike issue. However, they alleged being assaulted and heckled by BJP workers.

338.title: He seemed like a real gentleman, was really nice: Heard on meeting Musk at Met Gala 2016
338.article_body: While testifying in Johnny Depp's defamation trial against her, Amber Heard recalled the time when she appeared solo at Met Gala 2016 after Depp stood her up. She said she found herself standing next to Elon Musk. She added, "[Musk] was there with his mother...He reminded me we had met before...He seemed like a real gentleman. He was really nice."

339.title: LIC becomes 5th largest firm by m-cap after shares list at 9% discount
339.article_body: LIC has become the fifth-largest firm in the country by market capitalisation after it was listed at a 9% discount today. After listing, its market capitalisation rose to ₹5.70 lakh crore on BSE. In market capitalisation, ahead of LIC were Reliance Industries (₹16.74 lakh crore), TCS (₹12.38 lakh crore), HDFC Bank (₹7.23 lakh crore), Infosys (₹6.30 lakh crore) on BSE.

340.title: Rajasthan Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled after paper leak
340.article_body: A paper for the Rajasthan Police Constable recruitment exam has been cancelled after it was leaked, police said. Reports said the paper was leaked from an exam centre in Jhotwara before the second shift of exam on May 14. Police added that a case in connection with paper leak has been registered and that the exam will be conducted again.

341.title: Basmati seeds recalled by Karnal's IARI over poor germination complaints
341.article_body: The Indian Agricultural Research Institute's (IARI) regional centre in Karnal has recalled seeds of Pusa Basmati 1509 variety of rice it sold to farmers amid complaints of poor germination. Farmers of Punjab, Uttarakhand and UP had also purchased seeds from IARI's Karnal centre for early sowing. We will either replace the seeds or refund the money, an IARI scientist said.

342.title: Nearly 2 lakh people in 20 districts in Assam affected by floods: ASDMA
342.article_body: Around 1,97,248 people have been affected by the floods in 20 districts, the Assam State Disaster Management Authority (ASDMA) said. Hojai and Cachar are the worst hit with 78,157 and 51,357 people affected respectively, it added. At least two flood-related deaths were reported in the Cachar district and three casualties were earlier reported in Dima Hasao due to landslides.

343.title: Won't let Sweden, Finland join NATO: Turkey Prez
343.article_body: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan has said he will not let Sweden and Finland join NATO over their stand on Kurdish militants. "These two countries lack a clear stance against terrorism," said Erdogan, adding, "Sweden is a nesting ground for terrorist organisations." He further said he will block countries that impose sanctions against Turkey from joining NATO.

344.title: Twitter shares fall by 8% after Musk suggests price cut for $44 bn Twitter deal
344.article_body: After Tesla CEO Elon Musk said that the Twitter acquisition deal at a lower price is "not out of the question", shares of Twitter fell by 8% to close at $37.39. The stocks fell below the $39.31 closing price on April 1, when Musk had revealed his Twitter stake. The Twitter deal is currently on hold over fake accounts data.

345.title: Imran Khan's security enhanced after 'assassination plot' claim
345.article_body: The security arrangements for former Pakistan PM Imran Khan have been enhanced after he claimed a threat to his life. "A conspiracy is afoot to take my life," Khan had said, adding he had recorded a video naming those involved in the conspiracy. Following this, PM Shehbaz Sharif directed officials to provide foolproof security to Khan.

346.title: 'The Kashmir Files' movie has triggered violence in J&K: Mehbooba Mufti
346.article_body: Amid protests against the targeted killing of the Kashmiri Pandit Rahul Bhat by terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir, Peoples Democratic Party chief Mehbooba Mufti blamed Vivek Agnihotri's film 'The Kashmir Files' for triggering violence. "We created a safe atmosphere for Kashmiri Pandits. In 2016 during peak unrest, no killing happened. 'The Kashmir Files' movie has triggered violence," Mufti said.

347.title: Shivling claim unfair: AIMPLB on Gyanvapi Mosque case
347.article_body: Following claims of a Shivling being found in Varanasi’s Gyanvapi Mosque complex were reported, the All India Muslim Personal Law Board (AIMPLB) termed it as "unfair". "The attempt to declare it (mosque) a temple is nothing more than a conspiracy to create communal disharmony. It’s a matter of constitutional rights and is against the law," AIMPLB said in a statement.

348.title: Woman's family beats, parades man naked for 'texting her' in K'taka
348.article_body: A 20-year-old man was allegedly held captive, beaten and paraded naked in a village in Karnataka's Davanagere by a woman's family and some locals for "texting her", police said on Monday. This comes after purported videos of the incident, which occurred last week, surfaced online. The man's mother claimed in her complaint that he was held captive for two days.

349.title: Rupee hits new all-time low, slips to 77.73 against US dollar
349.article_body: The Indian rupee has touched a fresh all-time low of 77.73 against the US dollar as oil prices surged to near highest level in almost eight weeks.
