The rupee had ended at 77.45/dollar on Friday. Indian share markets are trading slightly higher with all eyes on the listing of state-run Life Insurance Corporation, the country's biggest IPO.

350.title: Daughter asked 'Mummy, is it cancer?', started crying: Chhavi on breast cancer
350.article_body: Actress Chhavi Mittal, who recently underwent surgery after being diagnosed with breast cancer, said that she told her daughter that she is "very unwell" and she is going to fix the problem. "She knows about cancer as I had lost my nani to esophageal cancer...She turned around and said, 'Mummy, is it that?' I said, 'Yes'...she started crying," Chhavi added.

351.title: DC's total was definitely chaseable for the batting we have: Mayank
351.article_body: PBKS captain Mayank Agarwal said they lost "too many" wickets in the first 10 overs and that's why they lost their game against DC. "It was definitely chaseable for the batting we have and the wicket wasn't as bad as it seemed," he added. DC posted 159/7 and restricted PBKS to 142/9 to win their seventh game of IPL 2022.

352.title: Delhi man jailed for demolishing neighbour's wall using excavator
352.article_body: A man has been sentenced to 45 days imprisonment by Delhi High Court after he demolished his neighbour's boundary wall using a JCB excavator in violation of a court order. The incident occurred in Delhi's Burari over a property dispute. Holding him guilty of contempt and rejecting his apology, the court said the demolition was a wilful and deliberate act.

353.title: Biden reverses Trump's withdrawal of US troops from Somalia
353.article_body: US President Joe Biden has approved the redeployment of US troops in Somalia, reversing a decision by his predecessor Donald Trump. The deployment was requested by US Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin to "enable a more effective fight against al-Shabaab". The Pentagon said the troops wouldn't be directly fighting in combat operations, but working to train, advise and equip Somali forces.

354.title: Gyanvapi mosque survey report not ready yet, will seek 3-4 days from court: Official
354.article_body: The Gyanvapi mosque survey report is not complete yet and is only 50% ready, Assistant Court Commissioner Ajay Pratap Singh said on Tuesday. "We will not be able to produce the report before the court today. We will seek three-four days' time from Varanasi court," he added. "The survey lasted for three days from May 14-16," Singh further said.

355.title: WB Guv seeks report over police 'trespass' at BJP MLA's office
355.article_body: West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar has sought a response from the state Chief Secretary over the alleged "criminal trespass" of state police and RAF at BJP MLA Suvendu Adhikari's office-cum-residence in Nandigram. Adhikari had shared videos of the incident on May 15, claiming that the "'Mamata' police had barged" in without any prior intimation. Dhankhar called the incident "worrisome".

356.title: Passengers travelling in Mumbai AC locals increase by 4 times from Feb to May
356.article_body: The number of passengers travelling by AC locals in Mumbai has increased from a daily average of 5,939 in February to 26,815 in May till date. "The response to AC locals upped after the slashing of single journey ticket rates by 50% from May 5," a railway official said. CSMT, Dombivli are top two stations in terms of ticket sale.

357.title: Was at badminton court while growing up, there was no time for movies: Deepika
357.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone said that her "growing up life" was very different from her friends from the industry. "I was at the badminton court and it was a very structured and disciplined life, in that sense. There was no time for movies," Deepika said, adding that she would watch only one or two movies in a year.

358.title: Telangana minister KTR slams PM Modi over his promise for ‘Achhe Din’
358.article_body: Telangana minister KT Rama Rao slammed Prime Minister Narendra Modi for not living up to his promise of 'Achhe Din' and said, "8 years ago...you had promised Achhe Din." "What your government has delivered - rupee at its lowest, highest unemployment in 45 years, highest inflation in 30 years, highest LPG price in...world, worst economy in 42 years," he added.

359.title: Would do anything to see you again: Ananya on grandmother's birth anniversary
359.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday took to her Instagram Stories to remember her late grandmother, Snehlata Panday, on her birth anniversary. Sharing an old picture of herself with her grandmother,  Ananya wrote, "Happy Birthday Dadi. I love and miss you so much. I would do anything to see you again." Ananya's grandmother passed away last year on July 10.

360.title: 'Gabbar Singh' director Harish working on a script for Salman: Report
360.article_body: Harish Shankar, director of films like 'Gabbar Singh' and 'Ramayya Vasthavayya', is reportedly writing a script for Salman Khan. "[He'll] discuss and pitch to him at the right time, in a right way when everything is finalised...Something big and interesting is on cards," the report said while quoting a source. Meanwhile, Salman is currently working on 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali'.

361.title: Hit by wheat export ban, Madhya Pradesh traders call mandi strike
361.article_body: Affected by the ban on wheat export, the traders' associations in Madhya Pradesh have called for a two-day bandh of mandis during which they will not participate in auctioning process of wheat. A traders' association said the ban has badly hit them as around 4,000 trucks from the state are stuck outside Kandla and Mumbai ports for 10 days.

362.title: LIC shares get listed on stock exchanges, trade at ₹872 in pre-open trade
362.article_body: India's largest insurer Life Insurance Corporation (LIC) listed its shares on the stock exchanges on Tuesday. In pre-open, the shares settled at ₹872 per share on NSE against its issue price of ₹949 apiece. The ₹20,557-crore IPO had closed on May 9. The LIC IPO was India's largest to date and had closed with nearly 3 times subscriptions.

363.title: Mehmood & Mithun's portrayal in films were strange, look odd today: Siddharth
363.article_body: Actor Siddharth spoke about the way non-Hindi speaking characters were shown as "caricatures" in Hindi cinema. He said, "From the age of comedians, [we had] actors like Mehmood who made unrealistic and strange portrayals which were very popular at that time. But today, you feel odd watching them." "There was Mithun Chakraborty playing...Krishnan Iyer and selling coconut water," he added.

364.title: 35-yr-old man held for 'forcefully' marrying minor cousin in Telangana
364.article_body: A 35-year-old man was arrested in Telangana’s Ranga Reddy for "forcefully" marrying his 12-year-old cousin, police said. The minor girl was rescued and her parents’ role is being probed as they allegedly misled her into the marriage on the pretext of attending a family function, according to the police. The minor girl lodged a police complaint, a police official said.

365.title: CBI conducts searches at multiple locations of Congress leader Karti Chidambaram
365.article_body: The CBI is conducting searches at multiple locations of Congress leader Karti Chidambaram in connection with an ongoing case, his office told news agency ANI. The searches are reportedly being conducted at around seven premises. In March, a Delhi court granted regular bail to Karti and his father P Chidambaram in Aircel-Maxis cases filed by CBI and ED.

366.title: Deepika Padukone attends jury dinner at Cannes 2022, pics surface
366.article_body: Deepika Padukone, who's a part of the main jury at the Cannes Film Festival 2022, joined the other jury members for dinner at the Grand Hyatt Cannes Hotel Martinez on Monday evening. She attended the dinner along with actress-filmmaker Rebecca Hall as well as directors Asghar Farhadi and Joachim Trier. Several pictures of Deepika from the event have surfaced online.

367.title: Woman judge killed, 3 others injured as car collides with jeep in Raj
367.article_body: A woman judge, Saroj Chaudhary, died and three others were injured after her car collided head-on with Irrigation Department Assistant Engineer Shankar Lal's jeep on Bikaner-Khajuwala highway in Rajasthan. Reports said that Saroj, who was in the back seat of the car, was bleeding profusely when she was taken to the hospital. The doctors then declared her dead.

368.title: Sharjeel Imam moves HC seeking bail after SC puts sedition on hold
368.article_body: JNU student leader Sharjeel Imam has moved Delhi High Court seeking bail after the Supreme Court recently ordered the sedition law to be put on hold. Imam has been booked under IPC Section 124A for allegedly giving inflammatory speeches during the anti-CAA protests. A two-judge bench is scheduled to hear the plea on May 17.

369.title: Pant shouldn't have fallen into PBKS' trap: RP Singh
369.article_body: Ex-India cricketer RP Singh has criticised DC captain Rishabh Pant for his batting approach during their match against PBKS. "Pant shouldn't have fallen into the trap...He had hit a six, another big shot was not needed...The team management also has to think about how Pant has to approach his innings," stated Singh. Pant was dismissed after scoring 7(3).

370.title: We're all commie as f***: Twitter's senior engineer in a leaked recording
370.article_body: In a leaked video recording, a senior engineer at Twitter was heard saying, "We're all commie as f***" while speaking in reference to how differently the company functions from Tesla CEO Elon Musk's firms. Siru Murugesan said, "He's a capitalist and we weren't really operating as capitalists, more like very socialist." He claimed employees tried to revolt against Musk's takeover.

371.title: Hyderabad Police arrests 8 for selling plots using fake documents
371.article_body: The Hyderabad Police on Sunday arrested eight people for allegedly forging documents and selling plots illegally. The case came to light after the complainant informed the police that the accused had forged property documents in the name of her husband who was dead. The accused persons then transferred the property to themselves and sold it for ₹6 crore, police said.

372.title: Kourtney Kardashian shares pics from her intimate wedding to Travis Barker
372.article_body: American media personality Kourtney Kardashian took to Instagram to confirm getting married to musician Travis Barker. Sharing pictures from their intimate wedding, Kourtney wrote, "Till death do us part." Commenting on her post, Kim Kardashian wrote, "Kravis forever." The duo had got engaged in October 2021 after having made their relationship official on Instagram in February last year.

373.title: India reports 1,569 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 16,400
373.article_body: India has reported 1,569 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,202 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in India stand at 16,400, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,260, according to the latest data.

374.title: It was Kohli's chance to win IPL, bowling that 1 over shattered me: Watson on 2016 final
374.article_body: Talking about the IPL 2016 final, wherein he conceded 24 runs off SRH's last over, Shane Watson said, "Bowling that one over just shattered me." He added, "RCB had played so well all year...Kohli, in particular, was on fire. It was his chance, one of the greatest players, to win that elusive IPL title as captain."

375.title: Ukraine evacuates troops from last holdout in besieged Mariupol city
375.article_body: More than 260 Ukrainian soldiers were evacuated from Mariupol's Azovstal steelworks, Ukraine's last stronghold in the port city, after weeks of resistance against the Russian invasion. All the evacuees, including 53 badly wounded troops, were taken to areas under Russia’s control. They will be subject to a potential prisoner exchange with Russia, Ukraine's Deputy Defence Minister Anna Malyar said.

376.title: Curfew in MP's Neemuch over clashes after Lord Hanuman idol placed near dargah
376.article_body: Clashes broke out between two communities on Monday after some people placed an idol of Lord Hanuman near a dargah in the old Kachari area in Madhya Pradesh's Neemuch, police said. The district administration imposed prohibitory orders under section 144 following the clashes. "During the clashes, some persons pelted stones damaging three-four motorcycles but no persons were injured," police added.

377.title: Twitter doesn't believe in free speech: Senior engineer in leaked recording
377.article_body: A senior engineer at Twitter has said the company "doesn't believe in free speech" and the employees "hated" Tesla CEO Elon Musk’s $44 billion takeover bid. An American activist group Project Veritas released a recording of Siru Murugesan's remarks. Murugesan said Twitter's office politics were quite left-leaning and the staff had to change their original views to adjust to it.

378.title: The only process was to take it deep: Pant on 17-run win vs PBKS
378.article_body: After DC defeated PBKS to register their second straight win, captain Rishabh Pant said he wanted to change the pattern of "losing one and winning one game". Talking about the match, Pant said, "The only process was to take it deep, with spinners getting help." He added, "[We'll] assess the wicket and see how [the next game] goes."

379.title: 21-yr-old man held for making derogatory video against Hindu deities in UP
379.article_body: A 21-year-old man was arrested for making a video in which he allegedly made derogatory remarks against Hindu deities, police said. The accused man, Umar Abdullah, purportedly posted an "inappropriate" video on social media. The incident was reported on May 14 and the accused was arrested on Monday after the police were tipped off about his presence in his locality.

380.title: Bengaluru reports less than 100 COVID-19 cases, positivity rate at 1.05%
380.article_body: Bengaluru on Monday reported 89 new COVID-19 cases, as compared to 118 new cases reported on Sunday. According to data published by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP), zero deaths were reported in the last 24 hours, while 131 people recovered from the virus during the same period. The positivity rate in the city now stands at 1.05%, the data showed.

381.title: 40-yr-old illegal market demolished in Mohali by GMADA, 4 acres freed
381.article_body: The Greater Mohali Area Development Authority (GMADA) on Monday carried out a demolition drive at the 40-year-old Shaheed Bhagat Singh Market in Phase-1, reclaiming around four acres of government land. Around 50 illegal temporary shops had come up at the market, officials said. The shopkeepers raised slogans to protest against the drive that continued from 12 pm to 3:30 pm.

382.title: Despite raid at dad's house, Madhuri shot for comedy scene: Rajkumar Santoshi
382.article_body: Filmmaker Rajkumar Santoshi said that once when he was shooting with actress Madhuri Dixit in Ooty, she shot for a comedy scene despite her father's house being raided in Mumbai at the same time. "She didn't let the director know...she was under stress and had to reach Mumbai...didn't let the director know...there was stress in her personal life," Santoshi added.

383.title: IISc B'lore develops tooth-cleaning nanobots for dental treatment
383.article_body: Researchers at Indian Institute of Science (IISc), Bangalore have developed nano-sized robots that can kill bacteria deep inside dentinal tubules and improve the success rate of root canal treatments. According to researchers, the existing techniques aren't efficient enough to go deep and kill the bacteria. They said the new technique allows nanobots to penetrate deep and clean the infection.

384.title: Over 100 Ghaziabad high-rises lack firefighting systems: Officials
384.article_body: Officials of Ghaziabad district's fire department said that they have inspected 113 residential high-rise buildings which lacked firefighting measures and have failed to adhere to fire safety norms. As per official records, Ghaziabad witnessed 3,177 fire incidents from January 2019 to March 2022. "We checked about 202 hospitals and only 42 of them had firefighting systems," an official said.

385.title: Thought I shouldn't be destroying what Rishi had done: Paresh on 'Sharmaji...'
385.article_body: Paresh Rawal spoke about the challenge of completing late actor Rishi Kapoor's 'Sharmaji Namkeen'. He said, "The challenge for me was what Rishi saab had done, I shouldn't be destroying that. Whatever he has sawed, without vandalising that, I need to carry it forward in a subtle way." "It was a relay race that I had to complete," he added.

386.title: BBMP identifies 9,500 potholes to fix in Bengaluru
386.article_body: Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has identified around 9,500 potholes in Bengaluru which it said will be fixed in a continuous exercise. "This is not the final number as the procedure has just been started and the data is only two to three days old," BBMP official said. The civic body will use FixMyStreet app to identify more potholes.

387.title: 20-yr-old woman raped at knifepoint in Mumbai, video filmed; 2 arrested
387.article_body: Police have arrested two brothers for allegedly raping a 20-year-old woman at knifepoint in Mumbai. Reports said that while one of them raped her, other filmed video and threatened to circulate it if she spoke about incident to anyone. Police said that accused entered her house in broad daylight and raped woman who had come to Mumbai two months ago.

388.title: 18-yr-old girl gives birth in Pune; parents booked for marrying her as minor
388.article_body: After an 18-year-old girl gave birth to a baby at Pune's Sassoon General Hospital recently, a case has been filed against her parents, husband, father-in-law and mother-in-law for allegedly getting her married when she was a minor. A police sub-inspector said that the girl had turned 18 this year in February. "No arrest has been made yet," the sub-inspector added.

389.title: upGrad launches Doctorate programs from global universities
389.article_body: upGrad has partnered with Golden Gate University, San Francisco and Swiss School of Business & Management, Geneva to offer Online DBA Programs for working professionals. Professionals with 5+ years of experience can now add a Doctor's title to their list of achievements by pursuing a thesis in their area of expertise, with 1:1 supervision from international faculty in 3 years.

390.title: 16-year-old boy killed as tempo hits two-wheeler in Pune
390.article_body: A 16-year-old boy was killed after a tempo first hit a hoarding, then rammed into a shed built in front of a butcher shop and then hit two two-wheeler vehicles in Pune's Dhankawadi, police said. The deceased teenager was sitting on one of the two two-wheelers, police added. The driver was driving the tempo without a permit, police further said.

391.title: Greek man gets life sentence for killing British wife in front of kid
391.article_body: A Greek pilot was sentenced to life in prison for killing his 20-year-old wife in front of their 11-month-old child last year. Babis Anagnostopoulos had initially claimed that thieves broke into their house and killed his wife and dog. Following evidence from CCTV cameras at their home and a smartwatch worn by his wife, the 34-year-old confessed to the murder.

392.title: Johnny Depp slapped me, squeezed my neck against railway car during honeymoon: Heard
392.article_body: While testifying in her ex-husband Johnny Depp's defamation trial against her, actress Amber Heard claimed that Depp hit her during their honeymoon. "Johnny slapped me across the face...He squeezed my neck against the railway car for what felt like a very long time." She added, "At some point he ripped his shirt off, and wrapped it around my neck."

393.title: How does the IPL 2022 points table read as DC enter top 4?
393.article_body: With their 17-run victory over PBKS, DC moved to the fourth position on the IPL 2022 points table. DC are fourth with 14 points and a net run-rate (NRR) of 0.255. Meanwhile, RCB are now fifth on the points table with 14 points and NRR of -0.323. KKR and PBKS are sixth and seventh, respectively.

394.title: T'gana owes GHMC ₹5,500 crore in property taxes as of April: Report
394.article_body: Telangana government and its undertakings owe Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation  (GHMC) over ₹5,500 crore in property taxes as of April, The Indian Express reported, citing an RTI response. In response to the RTI, the GHMC commissioner reportedly said that they've been regularly issuing notices for the payments. Some of the taxes have been pending for 25 years, the report said.

395.title: 5 feared drowned in Yamuna while escaping attack by rival group in Haryana
395.article_body: At least five men were feared drowned in Yamuna while escaping an attack by nearly 20 men of a rival group in Haryana's Yamunanagar, police said. They reportedly jumped into the water to save their lives. An NDRF team on Monday recovered three bodies. "The incident is said to be a fallout of multiple clashes between the groups," police added.

396.title: Twitter deal at a lower price is not out of the question, says Musk
396.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has said that the Twitter acquisition deal being viable at a lower cost is "not out of the question". Speaking at a conference, Musk said, "You can't pay the same price for something that is much worse than they claimed." He also said, "The more questions I ask, the more my concerns grow."

397.title: 207 bodies lying unclaimed in 10 Mumbai mortuaries since Feb 2021: Report
397.article_body: At least 207 bodies have been lying unclaimed in 10 mortuaries of civic and police surgeon-run hospitals across Mumbai since February 2021, a report said. According to the police manual, unclaimed bodies should be disposed within seven to 30 days. Officials said the unclaimed bodies that are usually of the victims of railway or road accidents are rarely identified.

398.title: Elisabeth Borne to become France's 1st female Prime Minister in 30 years
398.article_body: France's President Emmanuel Macron has appointed Labour Minister Elisabeth Borne as the country's new PM, the first woman to hold the position in three decades. This comes after Prime Minister Jean Castex submitted his resignation. During Borne's tenure as Labour Minister, unemployment fell to its lowest level in 15 years and youth unemployment to its lowest level in 40 years.

399.title: We suspend over half a million spam accounts every day: Twitter CEO
399.article_body: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal shared an extensive Twitter thread on spam accounts amid its acquisition deal with Tesla CEO Elon Musk being put on hold. Parag tweeted, "We suspend over half a million spam accounts every day, usually before any of you even see them on Twitter. We...lock millions of accounts each week that we suspect may be spam."

400.title: Twitter CEO posts long thread on spam accounts, Musk replies with poop emoji
400.article_body: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal on Monday tweeted a long thread on spam accounts amid Tesla CEO Elon Musk’s proposed acquisition being put on hold over fake accounts data. Speaking about Musk’s plan to identify bots, Parag said “We don't believe that this specific estimation can be performed externally”. In reply to this, Musk tweeted a poop emoji.

401.title: Mumbai auto unions to protest on May 17 demanding CNG price reduction
401.article_body: Auto-rickshaw unions in Mumbai will go on a day-long protest outside Mahanagar Gas Limited office in Bandra Kurla Complex on May 17 demanding a reduction in CNG prices. Auto-rickshaw unions are also demanding a ₹2 hike in base fare. "We expect around 5,000 drivers to turn up for the protest," said Mumbai Auto Rickshaw Taximen's Union President Shashank Rao.

402.title: 2 Mumbai homebuyers to get 7 times the price of undelivered flats
402.article_body: About 27 years after they booked flats in City Builders' City Embassy project in Kopar Khairane in Navi Mumbai, Gul Achra and Kanta Achra will receive ₹91 lakh and ₹88 lakh respectively as the builder failed to complete the project. While Gul had booked a flat worth ₹12.56 lakh in November 1995, Kanta had booked another flat for ₹13.16 lakh.

403.title: DC defeat PBKS by 17 runs, move to 4th position on IPL 2022 points table
403.article_body: DC defeated PBKS by 17 runs at the DY Patil Stadium in Mumbai to move to the fourth position on the IPL 2022 points table. DC and RCB now have 14 points each, with DC having a superior net run-rate (NRR). Mitchell Marsh top-scored for DC with 63(48), while DC fast bowler Shardul Thakur took four wickets in the match.
